en: But here were books, and here were men who had penetrated deeper and knew more. I took their word for all that they averred, and I became their disciple. It may appear strange that such should arise in the eighteenth century; but while I followed the routine of education in the schools of Geneva, I was, to a great degree, self-taught with regard to my favourite studies. My father was not scientific, and I was left to struggle with a child’s blindness, added to a student’s thirst for knowledge. Under the guidance of my new preceptors I entered with the greatest diligence into the search of the philosopher’s stone and the elixir of life; but the latter soon obtained my undivided attention. Wealth was an inferior object, but what glory would attend the discovery if I could banish disease from the human frame and render man invulnerable to any but a violent death!
vi: Nhưng đây thực sự là sách, và đây là những người đã đào sâu hơn và hiểu nhiều hơn. Họ khẳng định thế nào, tôi nhất nhất tin từng lời thế ấy, tôi trở thành môn đồ của họ. Cũng lạ lùng là ở thế kỷ mười tám còn có sự tình như vậy; nhưng trong khi theo đúng lối học quy định tại các trường ở Geneva, tôi chủ yếu vẫn là tự học, chỉ giới hạn trong những ngành mình thích. Cha tôi không biết nhiều về khoa học, tôi phải tự vật lộn với sự ngu dốt của một đứa bé, lại còn thêm sự khao khát hiểu biết của một học sinh. Dưới sự hướng dẫn của các ông thầy mới, tôi nhập vào cuộc nghiên cứu hòn đá phù thủy và trường sinh dược một cách cần mẫn nhất. Nhưng thuốc trường sinh chẳng mấy chốc thu hút toàn tâm toàn ý của tôi. Tiền của chỉ là vật hèn; nhưng khám phá của tôi sẽ được vinh diệu biết bao nếu như tôi trừ bỏ được bệnh tật khỏi cơ thể con người, làm con người miễn trừ với tất cả ngoài một cái chết dữ dội!
tr: Oysa şimdi karşımda daha derinlere inmeyi başarmış ve daha fazlasını bilen kitaplar ve insanlar vardı, öne sürdükleri tüm fikirleri benimsedim ve onların müridi oldum. Böyle bir durumun XVIII. yüzyıl gibi bir çağda ortaya çıkması insana garip gelebilir, ama ben bir yandan Cenevre okullarının sağladığı rutin eğitimi takip etmeyi sürdürüyor, bir yandan da ilgilendiğim konularda kendimi geliştiriyordum. Babam bilimsel eğilimlere sahip biri olmadığından ben bir öğrencinin bilgiye açlığının yanında, bir çocuğun körlüğüyle mücadelemi devam ettiriyordum. Öğretmenlerimin rehberliği altında, büyük bir sabırla felsefe taşının ve ölümsüzlük iksirinin arayışına giriştim. Ancak kısa süre sonra kendimi tamamen iksir konusuna verdim. Zenginlik bayağı bir amaçtı; ama hastalıkları insan bedeninden uzaklaştırabilmenin ve insanı acımasız bir ölüm dışında her şeye karşı dayanıklı kılabilmenin şanı kim bilir ne büyük olurdu!
es: Por tanto, y bajo promesa de absoluto secreto, le comuniqué mis descubrimientos a Elizabeth, pero el tema no le interesó y me vi obligado á continuar solo. Puede parecer extraño que en el siglo XVIII surja un discípulo de Alberto Magno, pero nuestra familia no era científica, y yo no había asistido a ninguna de las clases que se daban en la universidad de Ginebra. Así pues, mis sueños no se veían turbados por la realidad, y me lancé con enorme diligencia a la búsqueda de la piedra filosofal y el elixir de la vida[31]. Pero era esto último lo que recibía mi más completa atención: la riqueza era un objetivo inferior; pero ¡qué fama rodearía al descubrimiento si yo pudiera eliminar de la humanidad toda enfermedad y hacer invulnerables a los hombres a todo salvo a la muerte violenta!
vi_translation: But this is truly a book, and these are the people who have delved deeper and understood more. Whatever they assert, I believe every word exactly as they say, I become their disciple. It is also strange that in the eighteenth century there were such matters; but while following the prescribed curriculum at the schools in Geneva, I mainly self-studied, limiting myself to the subjects I liked. My father did not know much about science, I had to struggle with the ignorance of a child, along with the thirst for knowledge of a student. Under the guidance of my new teachers, I diligently engaged in the study of the philosopher's stone and the elixir of life. But the elixir of life soon captivated my entire attention. Money is just a trivial thing; but how glorious my discovery would be if I could eliminate disease from the human body, making humans immune to everything except a violent death!
tr_translation: However, now there were books and people in front of me who had managed to delve deeper and knew more, I adopted all the ideas they proposed and became their disciple. Such a situation might seem strange to someone in the XVIII. century, but while I continued to follow the routine education provided by the Geneva schools, I was also developing myself in the subjects I was interested in. Since my father did not have scientific inclinations, I continued my struggle with the blindness of a child alongside a student's hunger for knowledge. Under the guidance of my teachers, I embarked on the search for the philosopher's stone and the elixir of immortality with great patience. However, shortly after, I devoted myself entirely to the subject of the elixir. Wealth was a trivial goal; but who knows how great the glory would be of being able to remove diseases from the human body and make a person resilient to everything except a merciless death!
es_translation: Therefore, and under a promise of absolute secrecy, I shared my discoveries with Elizabeth, but the subject did not interest her and I was forced to continue alone. It may seem strange that in the 18th century a disciple of Albertus Magnus would emerge, but our family was not scientific, and I had not attended any of the classes given at the University of Geneva. Thus, my dreams were not disturbed by reality, and I launched myself with enormous diligence into the search for the philosopher's stone and the elixir of life[31]. But it was the latter that received my fullest attention: wealth was an inferior goal; but what fame would surround the discovery if I could eliminate all disease from humanity and make men invulnerable to everything except violent death!

en: She died calmly, and her countenance expressed affection even in death. I need not describe the feelings of those whose dearest ties are rent by that most irreparable evil, the void that presents itself to the soul, and the despair that is exhibited on the countenance. It is so long before the mind can persuade itself that she whom we saw every day and whose very existence appeared a part of our own can have departed for ever—that the brightness of a beloved eye can have been extinguished and the sound of a voice so familiar and dear to the ear can be hushed, never more to be heard. These are the reflections of the first days; but when the lapse of time proves the reality of the evil, then the actual bitterness of grief commences. Yet from whom has not that rude hand rent away some dear connection? And why should I describe a sorrow which all have felt, and must feel? The time at length arrives when grief is rather an indulgence than a necessity; and the smile that plays upon the lips, although it may be deemed a sacrilege, is not banished. My mother was dead, but we had still duties which we ought to perform; we must continue our course with the rest and learn to think ourselves fortunate whilst one remains whom the spoiler has not seized.
vi: Bà ra đi thanh thản, cả trong cái chết nét mặt vẫn thể hiện tình yêu thương trìu mến. Tôi không cần phải tả ra đây nỗi đau đớn của những người đã bị mất mát không tài nào bù đắp nổi này cắt đứt những mối tâm tình thân thiết nhất của mình; khoảng trống rỗng để lại trong mỗi tâm hồn, và nỗi đau thương đeo trên nét mặt chúng tôi. Phải mất bao lâu trí óc chúng tôi mới chấp nhận được là bà - người mà ngày nào chúng tôi cũng trông thấy, dường như đã là một phần của cuộc đời chúng tôi - lại có thể ra đi vĩnh viễn; ánh mắt sáng long lanh mà chúng tôi thương mến từ nay đã tắt hẳn; giọng nói quen thuộc quý yêu bên tai lại có thể bặt đi, không bao giờ còn vang lên. Những ngày đầu sau khi bà mất là như vậy đấy; nhưng khi thời gian trôi qua khẳng định đó là sự thật, nỗi đau xót thực sự mới bắt đầu. Thế nhưng đâu có ai chưa từng bị bàn tay phũ phàng kia dứt đi một mối duyên thân thiết? Và tôi cứ phải mô tả mãi làm gì nỗi đau mà ai cũng từng qua, và cũng phải qua? Cuối cùng cũng sẽ đến lúc đau thương là do buông thả thì đúng hơn là nhu cầu cần thiết, và nụ cười trên môi ta, dù có thể bị coi là báng bổ, không thể tắt bỏ hoàn toàn. Mẹ tôi đã mất, nhưng chúng tôi ai nấy đều có nhiệm vụ phải làm, phải đi theo con đường của mình cùng những người khác, tập suy nghĩ rằng mình may mắn khi còn chưa bị kẻ phá hoại cướp đi sinh mệnh.
tr: Annem sükûnet içinde öldü, öldüğünde dahi yüzü şefkat doluydu. Geri dönüşü imkânsız bir felaket tarafından en değerli bağlarından koparılanların duygularını, ruhların düştüğü boşluğu ve yüzlerden okunan çaresizliği tarif etmeme gerek yok sanırım. Her gün gördüğümüz ve varlığını varlığımızın bir parçası gibi benimsediğimiz kişinin sonsuza kadar aramızdan ayrılabileceğini, sevdiğiniz o gözlerdeki ışıltının sönüp gittiğini ve kulaklara öylesine aşina ve kıymetli gelen bir sesin susabileceğini, bir daha hiç duyulmayacağını akla kabul ettirmek öyle uzun zaman alıyor ki... İşte ilk günlere ait düşüncelerim bunlardı ama akıp giden zaman felaketin gerçekliğini yüze vurunca, asıl acı da kendini gösterdi. Ne var ki çok değerli bir bağı o kaba el tarafından çekilip koparılmamış kim var ki aramızda? Hem herkesin hissettiği ve hissetmesi gereken bir üzüntüyü neden tarife yelteneyim? Üzüntünün bir gereklilikten çok, alışkanlığa dönüştüğü bir zaman, eninde sonunda geliyor ve saygısızlık gibi görünse de dudaklarda gezinen gülümsemenin kayboluşu sonsuza kadar sürmüyor. Annem ölmüştü, ama hâlâ yerine getirmemiz gereken görevlerimiz vardı. Diğer herkesle birlikte yolumuza devam etmemiz ve o oyunbozan bizi ele geçirmedikçe, kendimizi şanslı saymamız gerekiyordu.
es: Murió dulcemente; y su rostro aun en la muerte reflejaba su cariño. No necesito describir los sentimientos de aquellos cuyos lazos más queridos se ven rotos por el más irreparable de los males, el vacío que inunda el alma y la desesperación que embarga el rostro. Pasa tanto tiempo antes de que uno se pueda persuadir de que aquella a quien veíamos cada día, y cuya existencia misma formaba parte de la nuestra, ya no está con nosotros; que se ha extinguido la viveza de sus amados ojos y que su voz tan dulce y familiar se ha apagado para siempre. Estos son los pensamientos de los primeros días. Pero la amargura del dolor no comienza hasta que el transcurso del tiempo demuestra la realidad de la pérdida. ¿Pero a quién no le ha robado esa desconsiderada mano algún ser querido? ¿Por qué, pues, había de describir el dolor que todos han sentido y deberán sentir? Con el tiempo llega el momento en el que el sufrimiento es más una costumbre que una necesidad y, aunque parezca un sacrilegio, y a no se reprime la sonrisa que asoma a los labios. Mi madre había muerto, pero nosotros aún teníamos obligaciones que cumplir; debíamos continuar nuestro camino junto a los demás y considerarnos afortunados mientras quedara a salvo al menos uno de nosotros.
vi_translation: She passed away peacefully, even in death her face still showed affectionate love. I don't need to describe here the pain of those who have suffered an irreparable loss that has severed their closest emotional bonds; the emptiness left in each soul, and the sorrow etched on our faces. How long did it take for our minds to accept that she - the person we saw every day, who seemed to be a part of our lives - could leave us forever; the bright, sparkling eyes we loved were now completely extinguished; the familiar, beloved voice by our ears could be silent, never to be heard again. Those were the first days after she passed away; but as time confirmed the truth, the real pain began. But who has never had a close bond severed by that cruel hand? And why should I keep describing the pain that everyone has experienced, and must experience? Eventually, there will come a time when sorrow is more due to indulgence than necessity, and the smile on our lips, though it may be considered blasphemous, cannot be completely extinguished. My mother has passed away, but each of us has duties to fulfill, to follow our own paths with others, and to think that we are fortunate to have not yet had our lives taken by the destroyer.
tr_translation: My mother died in peace, even in death her face was full of compassion. I suppose there is no need for me to describe the feelings of those torn from their most precious bonds by an irreversible disaster, the void into which their souls fall, and the helplessness read on their faces. It takes such a long time to accept the idea that the person we see every day and embrace as part of our existence could leave us forever, that the sparkle in those beloved eyes could fade away, and that a voice so familiar and precious to our ears could fall silent, never to be heard again... These were my thoughts in the early days, but as time flowed and the reality of the disaster became apparent, the real pain also revealed itself. Yet, who among us has not had a very precious bond pulled and severed by that rough hand? And why should I attempt to describe a sorrow that everyone feels and should feel? Eventually, a time comes when sorrow turns from a necessity into a habit, and although it may seem disrespectful, the disappearance of the smile that lingers on the lips does not last forever. My mother had died, but we still had duties to fulfill. We had to continue on our path with everyone else and consider ourselves lucky as long as that spoilsport did not catch us.
es_translation: She died peacefully; and her face even in death reflected her affection. I do not need to describe the feelings of those whose dearest bonds are broken by the most irreparable of evils, the void that floods the soul and the despair that overwhelms the face. So much time passes before one can persuade oneself that she whom we saw every day, and whose very existence was part of ours, is no longer with us; that the liveliness of her beloved eyes has been extinguished and that her sweet and familiar voice has been silenced forever. These are the thoughts of the first days. But the bitterness of grief does not begin until the passage of time demonstrates the reality of the loss. But who has not had some loved one stolen by that inconsiderate hand? Why, then, should I describe the pain that everyone has felt and must feel? With time comes the moment when suffering is more a habit than a necessity and, although it may seem sacrilegious, the smile that appears on the lips is no longer suppressed. My mother had died, but we still had obligations to fulfill; we had to continue our path alongside others and consider ourselves fortunate as long as at least one of us remained safe.

en: She indeed veiled her grief and strove to act the comforter to us all. She looked steadily on life and assumed its duties with courage and zeal. She devoted herself to those whom she had been taught to call her uncle and cousins. Never was she so enchanting as at this time, when she recalled the sunshine of her smiles and spent them upon us. She forgot even her own regret in her endeavours to make us forget.
vi: Nàng thực ra đã che giấu nỗi khổ tâm, đã gánh lấy vai trò xoa dịu tất cả chúng tôi. Nàng bình tĩnh xem xét cuộc sống phía trước, và can đảm cũng như hết sức nhiệt thành nhận lấy những trách nhiệm trong đó. Nàng hết lòng hy sinh cho những người nàng đã quen gọi là bác và các anh em họ. Chưa bao giờ nàng quyến rũ đến mức ấy khi nàng tìm lại nụ cười rực rỡ của mình để tỏa xuống chúng tôi. Và trong lúc cố gắng làm chúng tôi quên sầu muộn, nàng cũng đã bẵng quên luôn nỗi tiếc thương của chính mình.
tr: Elizabeth gerçekten de üzüntüsünü gizledi ve bizleri avutabilmek için elinden geleni yapmaya çalıştı. Hayatın karşısına metanetle dikildi ve sorumluluklarını cesaret ve azimle üstlendi. Kendisini amca ve kuzen diye hitap ettiği kişilere adadı. Gülüşü ışıltısına yeniden kavuşup da üstümüze yansıdığında hiç olmadığı kadar büyüleyiciydi. Bizleri teselli etmeye çalışırken kendi üzüntüsünü bile unuttu.
es: La muerte de mi madre y mi cercana marcha nos deprimía, pero Elizabeth intentaba reavivar la alegría en nuestro pequeño círculo. Desde la muerte de su tía había adquirido una nueva firmeza y vigor. Se propuso llevar a cabo sus obligaciones con la mayor exactitud, y entendió que su principal misión consistía en hacer felices a su tío y primos. A mí me consolaba, a su tío lo distraía, a mis hermanos los educaba. Nunca la vi tan encantadora como en estos momentos, cuando se desvivía por lograr la felicidad de los demás, olvidándose por completo de sí misma.
vi_translation: She had actually concealed her suffering and taken on the role of soothing all of us. She calmly considered the life ahead, and courageously and wholeheartedly accepted the responsibilities within it. She wholeheartedly sacrificed for those she had come to call uncles and cousins. She had never been so enchanting as when she found her radiant smile again to shine upon us. And in her efforts to make us forget our sorrow, she also inadvertently forgot her own grief.
tr_translation: Elizabeth truly hid her sorrow and tried her best to comfort us. She faced life with fortitude and took on her responsibilities with courage and determination. She dedicated herself to those she called uncle and cousin. When her smile regained its radiance and reflected upon us, it was more enchanting than ever. While trying to console us, she even forgot her own sorrow.
es_translation: The death of my mother and my imminent departure depressed us, but Elizabeth tried to revive the joy in our small circle. Since the death of her aunt, she had acquired a new firmness and vigor. She set out to carry out her duties with the utmost precision, and understood that her main mission was to make her uncle and cousins happy. She consoled me, distracted her uncle, and educated my brothers. I never saw her as charming as in these moments, when she was striving to achieve the happiness of others, completely forgetting about herself.

en: He then took me into his laboratory and explained to me the uses of his various machines, instructing me as to what I ought to procure and promising me the use of his own when I should have advanced far enough in the science not to derange their mechanism. He also gave me the list of books which I had requested, and I took my leave.
vi: Thầy đưa tôi vào phòng thí nghiệm của mình, giải thích cách sử dụng những máy móc lạ lùng trong đó, dạy tôi phải kiếm được cái nào, hứa cho tôi sử dụng máy móc của thầy khi tôi đã tiến đủ xa trong việc học hành để khỏi làm hỏng chúng. Thầy cũng đưa tôi danh sách cần đọc như tôi yêu cầu; và tôi cáo lui.
tr: Ardından beni laboratuvarına götürerek çeşitli makinelerin kullanımını açıkladı ve çalışmalarım için edinmem gereken gereçleri anlattı. Mekanizmalarını bozmayacak kadar ilerlediğimde, kendi aletlerini kullanmama izin vereceğine söz verdi. Ayrıca isteğim üzerine bana bir kitap listesi hazırladı ve yanından ayrıldım.
es: Me condujo entonces a su laboratorio y me explicó el uso de sus diversas máquinas, indicándome lo que debía comprarme. Me prometió que, cuando hubiera progresado lo suficiente en mis estudios como para no deteriorarlo, me permitiría utilizar su propio material. También me dio la lista de libros que le había pedido y seguidamente me marché.
vi_translation: The teacher took me into his laboratory, explained how to use the strange machines there, taught me which ones to acquire, and promised to let me use his machines once I had advanced far enough in my studies to avoid damaging them. He also gave me a reading list as I requested; and I took my leave.
tr_translation: Then he took me to his laboratory, explained the use of various machines, and described the equipment I needed to acquire for my work. He promised that when I had advanced enough not to damage their mechanisms, he would allow me to use his own tools. Additionally, at my request, he prepared a list of books for me, and I left his side.
es_translation: He then led me to his laboratory and explained the use of his various machines, indicating what I should buy for myself. He promised me that, when I had progressed enough in my studies to not damage it, he would allow me to use his own equipment. He also gave me the list of books I had asked for and then I left.

en: Remember, I am not recording the vision of a madman. The sun does not more certainly shine in the heavens than that which I now affirm is true. Some miracle might have produced it, yet the stages of the discovery were distinct and probable. After days and nights of incredible labour and fatigue, I succeeded in discovering the cause of generation and life; nay, more, I became myself capable of bestowing animation upon lifeless matter.
vi: Anh nhớ cho, tôi không ghi lại ảo ảnh của một thằng điên đâu. Điều tôi khẳng định là sự thực, thực cũng như mặt trời tỏa sáng trên bầu trời vậy. Có lẽ phép thần thông nào đó đã đưa nó tới, tuy nhiên mỗi giai đoạn của khám phá đều rõ rệt, đều hoàn toàn hợp lý. Sau nhiều đêm ngày vất vả mệt nhọc không sao tả xiết, tôi đã thành công trong việc phát hiện nguyên nhân của sinh sản và sự sống; chưa hết, tôi đã đạt tới mức có thể trao sự sống cho vật chất vốn vô tri vô giác.
tr: Unutma ki bir delinin hayalleri değildi bunlar. Gökte parlayan güneşin ışıkları bile, doğruluğunu beyan ettiğim bu şeyden daha kati değildir. Gerçekleşmesi bir mucizenin eseriydi belki, ama keşfin aşamaları gayet belirgin ve ihtimal dahilindeydi. Akıl almaz bir çalışma ve Yorgunlukla geçen geceler ve gündüzlerin ardından oluşumun ve yaşamın sırrını keşfetmiştim. Dahası cansız varlıklara hayat verebilir hale gelmiştim.
es: Recuerde que no narro las fantasías de un iluminado; lo que digo es tan cierto como que el sol brilla en el cielo. Quizá algún milagro hubiera podido producir esto, mas las etapas de mi investigación eran claras y verosímiles. Tras noches y días de increíble labor y fatiga, conseguí descubrir el origen de la generación y la vida; es más, yo mismo estaba capacitado para infundir vida en la materia inerte[40].
vi_translation: Remember, I am not recording the hallucinations of a madman. What I assert is the truth, as real as the sun shining in the sky. Perhaps some magical power brought it here, but every stage of the discovery was clear and completely logical. After many nights and days of indescribable toil and fatigue, I succeeded in discovering the cause of reproduction and life; furthermore, I reached the point where I could bestow life upon inanimate matter.
tr_translation: Remember that these were not the dreams of a madman. Even the rays of the sun shining in the sky are not more certain than this thing I declare to be true. Its realization might have been the work of a miracle, but the stages of discovery were quite clear and within the realm of possibility. After nights and days filled with incredible work and fatigue, I had discovered the secret of creation and life. Moreover, I had become capable of giving life to inanimate objects.
es_translation: Remember that I do not narrate the fantasies of an enlightened one; what I say is as true as the sun shining in the sky. Perhaps some miracle could have produced this, but the stages of my investigation were clear and plausible. After nights and days of incredible labor and fatigue, I managed to discover the origin of generation and life; moreover, I myself was capable of infusing life into inanimate matter[40].

en: The summer months passed while I was thus engaged, heart and soul, in one pursuit. It was a most beautiful season; never did the fields bestow a more plentiful harvest or the vines yield a more luxuriant vintage, but my eyes were insensible to the charms of nature. And the same feelings which made me neglect the scenes around me caused me also to forget those friends who were so many miles absent, and whom I had not seen for so long a time. I knew my silence disquieted them, and I well remembered the words of my father: “I know that while you are pleased with yourself you will think of us with affection, and we shall hear regularly from you. You must pardon me if I regard any interruption in your correspondence as a proof that your other duties are equally neglected.”
vi: Các tháng hè trôi qua trong khi tôi vẫn mải mê làm việc, toàn tâm toàn ý. Lúc này là mùa đẹp nhất trong năm, đồng lúa chưa bao giờ báo hiệu được mùa hơn thế, đồng nho cũng hứa hẹn bội thu, thế nhưng mắt tôi hoàn toàn vô cảm với vẻ đẹp của thiên nhiên. Lãnh cảm với cảnh vật quanh mình thế nào tôi cũng quên bẵng bạn bè nơi quê hương xa xôi cách trở, lâu ngày không gặp thế ấy. Tôi biết sự im lặng của tôi khiến họ lo âu, và tôi rất nhớ lời căn dặn của cha tôi: “Cha biết trong khi vui cuộc sống con vẫn nhớ tới chúng ta với tình thương yêu trìu mến, và nhà sẽ thường nhận được thư con. Con sẽ không thể trách được nếu cha coi việc con trễ nải thư từ cũng có nghĩa là con đang sao lãng mọi nhiệm vụ khác của mình.”
tr: Yaz ayları bu şekilde, ruhum ve yüreğimle tek bir amacın peşinde koşarak geldi geçti. Oysa mevsim çok güzeldi, tarlalar hiç bu kadar bol ekinle dolup taşmamış, bağ bozumu hiç böyle zengin olmamıştı. Benim gözlerimse doğanın cazibelerine karşı duyarsızlaşmıştı. Etrafımı kuşatan manzarayı görmezden gelmeme neden olan hisler, bana uzun süredir görüşmediğim, millerce uzaktaki dostlarımı da unutturuyordu. Sessizliğimin onları endişelendirdiğini biliyor ve babamın sözlerini gayet iyi hatırlıyordum: "Halinden hoşnutken bizleri sevgiyle anacağını ve senden düzenli haber alacağımızı zaten biliyorum. Ancak haberleşmemiz kesintiye uğradığında, bunu diğer görevlerini de aksattığının bir delili olarak yorumlarsam kusuruma bakma.
es: Transcurrió el verano mientras yo seguía entregado a mi objetivo en cuerpo y alma. Fue un verano hermosísimo; jamás habían producido los campos cosecha más abundante ni las cepas, mayor vendimia; pero yo estaba ciego a los encantos de la naturaleza. Los mismos sentimientos que me hicieron insensible a lo que me rodeaba me hicieron olvidar aquellos amigos, a tantas, millas de mí, a quienes no había visto en mucho tiempo. Sabía que mi silencio les inquietaba, y recordaba claramente las palabras de mi padre: «Mientras estés contento de ti mismo, sé que pensarás en nosotros con afecto, y sabremos de ti. Me disculparás si tomo cualquier interrupción en tu correspondencia como señal de que también estás abandonando el resto de tus obligaciones».
vi_translation: The summer months passed by while I was still engrossed in work, wholeheartedly dedicated. This is the most beautiful season of the year, the rice fields have never signaled a better harvest, and the vineyards also promise a bountiful yield, yet my eyes are completely indifferent to the beauty of nature. Just as I am indifferent to the scenery around me, I also completely forget my friends in the distant, inaccessible homeland, whom I haven't seen for a long time. I know my silence makes them anxious, and I deeply miss my father's advice: “I know that while enjoying life, you still think of us with affectionate love, and the house will often receive your letters. You cannot blame me if I consider your neglect of correspondence as a sign that you are neglecting all your other duties as well.”
tr_translation: The summer months passed by in this way, chasing a single goal with my soul and heart. Yet the season was very beautiful, the fields had never been so full of crops, and the harvest had never been so abundant. But my eyes had become insensitive to the charms of nature. The feelings that caused me to ignore the scenery surrounding me also made me forget my friends who were miles away and whom I hadn't seen for a long time. I knew that my silence worried them, and I remembered my father's words very well: "We already know that when you are content, you will remember us with love and that we will receive regular news from you. But if our communication is interrupted, please don't take it amiss if I interpret it as a sign that you are neglecting your other duties as well."
es_translation: The summer passed while I remained devoted to my goal in body and soul. It was a most beautiful summer; never had the fields produced a more abundant harvest nor the vines a greater vintage; but I was blind to the charms of nature. The same feelings that made me insensitive to my surroundings made me forget those friends, so many miles away, whom I had not seen in a long time. I knew that my silence worried them, and I clearly remembered my father's words: "As long as you are content with yourself, I know you will think of us with affection, and we will hear from you. You will excuse me if I take any interruption in your correspondence as a sign that you are also neglecting the rest of your duties."

en: By very slow degrees, and with frequent relapses that alarmed and grieved my friend, I recovered. I remember the first time I became capable of observing outward objects with any kind of pleasure, I perceived that the fallen leaves had disappeared and that the young buds were shooting forth from the trees that shaded my window. It was a divine spring, and the season contributed greatly to my convalescence. I felt also sentiments of joy and affection revive in my bosom; my gloom disappeared, and in a short time I became as cheerful as before I was attacked by the fatal passion.
vi: Thật chậm chạp, với nhiều đợt suy sụp lặp lại thường xuyên khiến bạn tôi hoảng hốt và xót ruột, tôi hồi phục lại. Tôi vẫn nhớ lần đầu tiên tôi lại có thể quan sát sự vật quanh mình với chút ít thích thú, tôi thấy rằng lá úa đã biến mất hoàn toàn, chồi non đang mọc ra từ đám cây xòa bóng vào cửa sổ. Mùa xuân ấy thật là thần thánh, và mùa xuân đến đã giúp cho dưỡng bệnh của tôi rất nhiều. Tôi cũng cảm thấy những cảm xúc vui sướng và yêu thương trở lại trong lồng ngực; tâm trạng u ám biến mất, và sau một thời gian ngắn tôi lại vui vẻ yêu đời như lúc chưa rơi vào niềm mê đắm định mệnh kia.
tr: Arkadaşımı korkutacak ve üzecek sıklıkta nükseden hastalığım, yavaş yavaş iyileşti. Etrafımdaki nesneleri keyifle izlediğim ilk ânı hatırlıyorum. Solup düşen yaprakların ortadan kalktığını ve penceremi gölgeleyen ağaçların tohumlandığını fark ettim. Muhteşem bir bahar başlamak üzereydi ve mevsimin iyileşmeme büyük katkısı oluyordu. Sevinç ve şefkat gibi duyguların da içimde yeniden canlandığını hissettim. Karamsarlığım kaybolmuştu ve kısa sürede ölümcül tutkuma yakalanmadan önceki neşeme dönüverdim.
es: Muy poco a poco, y con numerosas recaídas que inquietaban y apenaban a mi amigo, me repuse. Recuerdo que la primera vez que con un atisbo de placer me pude fijar en los objetos a mí alrededor, observé que habían desaparecido las hojas muertas, y tiernos brotes cubrían los árboles que daban sombra a mi ventana. Fue una primavera deliciosa, y la estación contribuyó mucho a mi mejoría. Sentí renacer en mí sentimientos de afecto y alegría; desapareció mi pesadumbre, y pronto recuperé la animación que tenía antes de sucumbir a mi horrible obsesión.
vi_translation: Slowly, with many frequent relapses that alarmed and distressed my friend, I recovered. I still remember the first time I was able to observe the things around me with a bit of interest again, I saw that the withered leaves had completely disappeared, and new buds were sprouting from the trees casting shadows on the window. That spring was truly divine, and the arrival of spring greatly aided my convalescence. I also felt the return of joy and love in my chest; the gloomy mood vanished, and after a short time, I was once again cheerful and full of life as I had been before falling into that fateful infatuation.
tr_translation: My illness, which recurred frequently enough to scare and upset my friend, gradually healed. I remember the first moment I watched the objects around me with pleasure. I noticed that the fallen leaves had disappeared and the trees shading my window had seeded. A magnificent spring was about to begin, and the season was greatly contributing to my recovery. I felt that emotions like joy and compassion were being rekindled within me. My pessimism had vanished, and I quickly returned to the cheerfulness I had before succumbing to my deadly obsession.
es_translation: Very slowly, and with numerous relapses that worried and saddened my friend, I recovered. I remember that the first time I could focus on the objects around me with a hint of pleasure, I noticed that the dead leaves had disappeared, and tender shoots covered the trees that shaded my window. It was a delightful spring, and the season greatly contributed to my improvement. I felt feelings of affection and joy reborn in me; my sorrow disappeared, and soon I regained the liveliness I had before succumbing to my horrible obsession.

en: “You will repay me entirely if you do not discompose yourself, but get well as fast as you can; and since you appear in such good spirits, I may speak to you on one subject, may I not?”
vi: “Đừng lo ngại gì, cứ mau khỏe lên tức là bạn đã trả ơn tôi hoàn toàn rồi đó; và tiện đây bạn đang vui vẻ thế này, tôi nói với bạn vấn đề này được không?”
tr: "Yine kendini dağıtmaz, olabildiğince çabuk iyileşirsen, bana olan borcunu tamamen ödemiş olursun. Hazır böyle keyfin yerindeyken seninle bir konuyu konuşabilirim herhalde, değil mi?
es: —Me consideraré bien pagado si dejas de atormentarte y te recuperas rápidamente, y puesto que te veo tan mejorado, ¿me permitirás una pregunta?
vi_translation: “Don't worry about anything, just getting well quickly means you have completely repaid me; and while you're in such good spirits, can I talk to you about this matter?”
tr_translation: "If you don't let yourself fall apart and recover as quickly as possible, you will have fully repaid your debt to me. Since you're in such a good mood, I suppose I can talk to you about something, right?"
es_translation: —I will consider myself well paid if you stop tormenting yourself and recover quickly, and since I see you so improved, will you allow me a question?

en: I remained two days at Lausanne, in this painful state of mind. I contemplated the lake: the waters were placid; all around was calm; and the snowy mountains, “the palaces of nature,” were not changed. By degrees the calm and heavenly scene restored me, and I continued my journey towards Geneva.
vi: Tôi ở lại Lausanne hai ngày trong tình trạng tinh thần thiểu não ấy. Tôi ngắm mặt hồ: mặt nước bình lặng, xung quanh vẫn yên tĩnh, những ngọn núi tuyết phủ, “những tòa lâu đài của thiên nhiên” không hề thay đổi. Dần dần, cảnh vật êm đềm thanh khiết khiến tôi bình tâm lại, tiếp tục hành trình đi Geneva.
tr: Bu perişan ruh hali içinde, Lozan'da iki gün dolandım. Uzun uzun gölü seyrettim. Suları berraktı, çevresi dingin. ‘Tabiatın sarayı” karlı dağlarsa hiç değişmemişti. Bu sakin ve ilahî manzara yavaş yavaş beni yatıştırdı ve nihayet Cenevre yolculuğuma devam ettim.
es: Me quedé dos días en Lausana, sumido en este doloroso estado de ánimo. Contemplé el lago: sus aguas estaban en calma, todo a mí alrededor respiraba paz y los nevados montes, «palacios de la naturaleza»[51], no habían cambiado. Poco a poco, el maravilloso y sereno espectáculo me restableció, y proseguí mi viaje hacia Ginebra.
vi_translation: I stayed in Lausanne for two days in that melancholic state of mind. I gazed at the lake: the water's surface was calm, the surroundings still quiet, the snow-covered mountains, "the castles of nature," remained unchanged. Gradually, the serene and pure scenery calmed me down, allowing me to continue my journey to Geneva.
tr_translation: In this miserable state of mind, I wandered around Lausanne for two days. I watched the lake for a long time. The waters were clear, the surroundings tranquil. The "palace of nature," the snowy mountains, had not changed at all. This serene and divine landscape gradually calmed me, and finally, I continued my journey to Geneva.
es_translation: I stayed two days in Lausanne, immersed in this painful state of mind. I gazed at the lake: its waters were calm, everything around me breathed peace, and the snowy mountains, "palaces of nature," had not changed. Little by little, the wonderful and serene spectacle restored me, and I continued my journey to Geneva.

en: The road ran by the side of the lake, which became narrower as I approached my native town. I discovered more distinctly the black sides of Jura, and the bright summit of Mont Blanc. I wept like a child. “Dear mountains! my own beautiful lake! how do you welcome your wanderer? Your summits are clear; the sky and lake are blue and placid. Is this to prognosticate peace, or to mock at my unhappiness?”
vi: Con đường chạy dọc bờ hồ và ngày càng hẹp lại khi về gần đến thành phố quê hương. Tôi nhìn thấy rõ hơn sườn tối của dãy Jura và đỉnh Mont Blanc sáng chói; tôi khóc như một đứa trẻ. “Những ngọn núi thân thương của ta! Hồ đẹp của riêng ta! Các ngươi đón chào kẻ lang thang của các ngươi như thế nào đây? Đỉnh núi sáng trong, màu trời và màu nước hồ đều xanh đều dịu.
tr: Yol, gölün kıyısından ilerliyor ve kasabama yaklaştıkça daralıyordu. Jura’nın kara yamaçları ve Mont Blanc’ m parlak zirvesi artık daha net görülüyordu. Bir çocuk gibi ağladım. “Sevgili dağlar! Benim güzel gölüm! Gezgininizi nasıl karşılıyorsunuz böyle? Zirveleriniz berrak; gökyüzü ve göl ise masmavi ve dingin. Bu halinizle huzurun habercisi misiniz, yoksa mutsuzluğumla alay mı ediyorsunuz?
es: La carretera bordeaba el lago y se angostaba al acercarse a mi ciudad natal. Distinguí con la mayor claridad las oscuras laderas de los montes jurásicos y la brillante cima del Mont Blanc. Lloré como un chiquillo: «¡Queridas montañas! ¡Mi hermoso lago! ¿Cómo recibís al caminante? Vuestras cimas centellean, el lago y el cielo son azules… ¿Es esto una promesa de paz o es una burla a mi desgracia?».
vi_translation: The road runs along the lakeshore and gradually narrows as it approaches the hometown city. I could see more clearly the dark side of the Jura range and the dazzling peak of Mont Blanc; I cried like a child. “My dear mountains! My beautiful lake! How do you welcome your wanderer? The peaks are bright, the sky and the lake water are both gently blue. Is this a sign of peaceful tranquility or a mockery of my misfortune?”
tr_translation: The road was advancing along the lakeshore and narrowing as it approached my town. The dark slopes of Jura and the bright peak of Mont Blanc were now more clearly visible. I cried like a child. “Dear mountains! My beautiful lake! How do you welcome your traveler like this? Your peaks are clear; the sky and the lake are deep blue and serene. Are you heralding peace in this state, or are you mocking my misery?”
es_translation: The road bordered the lake and narrowed as it approached my hometown. I could clearly distinguish the dark slopes of the Jurassic mountains and the bright summit of Mont Blanc. I cried like a child: "Dear mountains! My beautiful lake! How do you welcome the traveler? Your peaks sparkle, the lake and the sky are blue... Is this a promise of peace or a mockery of my misfortune?"

en: This state of mind preyed upon my health, which had perhaps never entirely recovered from the first shock it had sustained. I shunned the face of man; all sound of joy or complacency was torture to me; solitude was my only consolation—deep, dark, deathlike solitude.
vi: Tình trạng tinh thần như thế khiến sức khỏe tôi, có lẽ chưa bao giờ hoàn toàn hồi phục sau cú sốc ban đầu, càng thêm hao mòn. Tôi tránh mặt mọi người; những dấu hiệu từ sự vui vẻ hài lòng đối với tôi chẳng khác gì tra tấn; tôi chỉ còn tìm an ủi ở sự cô đơn - nỗi cô đơn đen tối, sâu thẳm như cõi chết.
tr: Bu ruh hali, ilk şoku büyük ihtimalle hâlâ tam olarak atlatamamış olan sağlığımı kemiriyordu. İnsanlardan köşe bucak kaçıyordum. Sevinç ve mutluluğa dair tüm sesler bana eziyet gibi geliyordu. Tek tesellim yalnızlıktı; derin, kapkaranlık, ölüm gibi bir yalnızlık.
es: Este estado de ánimo amenazaba mi salud, repuesta ya por completo del primer golpe que había sufrido. Rehuía ver a nadie, y toda manifestación de júbilo o complacencia era para mí un suplicio. Mi único consuelo era la soledad; una soledad profunda, oscura, semejante a la de la muerte.
vi_translation: The mental state like that caused my health, which perhaps had never fully recovered after the initial shock, to deteriorate even further. I avoided everyone; signs of joy and satisfaction were nothing but torture to me; I found solace only in solitude - a solitude as dark and deep as death.
tr_translation: This state of mind was gnawing at my health, which most likely still hadn't fully recovered from the initial shock. I was avoiding people at all costs. All sounds of joy and happiness felt like torture to me. My only solace was solitude; deep, pitch-black, death-like solitude.
es_translation: This state of mind threatened my health, which had already fully recovered from the first blow I had suffered. I avoided seeing anyone, and any display of joy or satisfaction was torture for me. My only solace was solitude; a deep, dark solitude, similar to that of death.

en: Where had they fled when the next morning I awoke? All of soul-inspiriting fled with sleep, and dark melancholy clouded every thought. The rain was pouring in torrents, and thick mists hid the summits of the mountains, so that I even saw not the faces of those mighty friends. Still I would penetrate their misty veil and seek them in their cloudy retreats. What were rain and storm to me? My mule was brought to the door, and I resolved to ascend to the summit of Montanvert. I remembered the effect that the view of the tremendous and ever-moving glacier had produced upon my mind when I first saw it. It had then filled me with a sublime ecstasy that gave wings to the soul and allowed it to soar from the obscure world to light and joy. The sight of the awful and majestic in nature had indeed always the effect of solemnising my mind and causing me to forget the passing cares of life. I determined to go without a guide, for I was well acquainted with the path, and the presence of another would destroy the solitary grandeur of the scene.
vi: Chúng đã biến hết đi đâu khi tôi tỉnh dậy sáng hôm sau? Giấc ngủ trôi qua, mọi thứ truyền cho tâm hồn tôi sức sống cũng trôi theo nốt, nỗi u sầu tăm tối lại che phủ mọi ý nghĩ của tôi. Mưa rơi xối xả, sương mù dày đặc che khuất những ngọn núi, thậm chí tôi còn không nhìn được gương mặt những người bạn hùng mạnh của tôi. Thế nhưng tôi vẫn muốn xuyên qua tấm mạng sương mù đó, đi tìm họ về tận chốn trú ẩn giăng mây của họ. Mưa bão đối với tôi nghĩa lý gì? Con la đã được đem đến trước cửa, tôi quyết định sẽ lên tận đỉnh núi Montanvert. Tôi còn nhớ ấn tượng lần đầu trông thấy trên núi mặt biển băng lớn mênh mông và không ngừng di chuyển. Lúc đó tôi đã có một cảm giác say sưa cao cả đến tuyệt vời khiến tâm hồn tôi cất cánh bay bổng khỏi chốn trần tục tối tăm lên nơi chỉ có niềm vui và ánh sáng. Cảnh tượng thiên nhiên oai nghiêm đến dễ sợ bao giờ cũng làm trí não tôi trang nghiêm trở lại, quên đi những lo toan thoáng qua của đời thường. Tôi quyết định leo núi không cần người hướng dẫn, bởi tôi đã quen thuộc con đường, hơn nữa có mặt thêm một người khác sẽ làm khung cảnh bớt đi vẻ huy hoàng cô độc.
tr: Sabah uyandığımda neredeydiler acaba? Ruhumu canlandıranların hepsi uykuyla birlikte kayıplara karışmıştı ve kapkara melankoli tüm düşüncelerimi gölgelemeye başlamıştı. Bardaktan boşanırcasına yağmur yağıyordu ve kalın bir sis, dağların zirvelerini sarmıştı. Böylece o kudretli dostların çehrelerini de göremez oldum. Yine de pustan peçelerine nüfuz edebilir, onları dumanlı sığınaklarında arayabilirdim. Yağmur, fırtına da neymiş? Katırım kapıya getirildi ve Montanvert'in zirvesine tırmanmaya karar verdim. Devasa, sürekli hareket eden buzulu ilk görüşümün zihnimde yarattığı etkiyi hatırladım. Ruhu kanatlandırarak meçhul bir dünyadan aydınlığa ve sevince doğru taşıyan yüce bir coşku doldurmuştu içimi. Doğadaki o heybet ve azamet oldum olası zihnimi yatıştırmış, hayatın gelip geçici dertlerini unutmamı sağlamıştı. Yolu iyi bildiğimden ve başka birinin varlığı manzaranın ıssız ihtişamını bozacağından rehbersiz gitmeye karar verdim.
es: —Querido primo —me dijo—, ¿ves cuánta felicidad contagias cuando estás alegre? ¡No recaigas de nuevo! La mañana siguiente amaneció con una lluvia torrencial, y una espesa niebla ocultaba las cimas de las montañas. Me levanté temprano, pero me sentía melancólico. La lluvia me deprimía; volvió mi acostumbrado estado de ánimo, y me sentí apesadumbrado. Sabía lo que este cambio brusco apenaría a mi padre y preferí evitarlo, hasta haberme recobrado lo suficiente como para poder disimular estos sentimientos que me dominaban. Supuse que pasarían el día en el albergue, y dado que yo estaba acostumbrado a la lluvia, la humedad y el frío, decidí ir solo a la cima del Montanvert[58]. Recordaba la impresión que el inmenso glaciar en constante movimiento me había causado la primera vez que lo vi. Entonces me había llenado de un éxtasis que prestaba alas al espíritu, permitiéndole despegarse del mundo de tinieblas y remontarse hasta la luz y la felicidad. La contemplación de todo lo que de majestuoso y sobrecogedor hay en la naturaleza siempre ha tenido la virtud de ennoblecer mis sentimientos y me ha hecho olvidar las efímeras preocupaciones de la vida. Decidí ir solo, pues conocía bien el camino, y la presencia de otro hubiera destruido la grandiosa soledad del paraje.
vi_translation: Where had they all gone when I woke up the next morning? As sleep passed, everything that had given my soul vitality also drifted away, and the dark melancholy once again shrouded all my thoughts. The rain poured down, and thick fog obscured the mountains; I couldn't even see the faces of my mighty friends. Yet I still wanted to pierce through that veil of fog, to seek them out in their cloud-shrouded refuge. What did the storm mean to me? The mule had been brought to the door, and I decided to ascend to the summit of Montanvert. I still remember the impression of first seeing the vast, ever-moving sea of ice on the mountain. At that moment, I felt a sublime exhilaration that lifted my soul from the dark earthly realm to a place of pure joy and light. The awe-inspiring and fearsome spectacle of nature always restored a sense of solemnity to my mind, making me forget the fleeting worries of everyday life. I decided to climb the mountain without a guide, as I was familiar with the path, and having another person present would diminish the solitary grandeur of the scene.
tr_translation: I wonder where they were when I woke up in the morning? All those who invigorated my soul had vanished with sleep, and pitch-black melancholy had begun to overshadow all my thoughts. It was raining cats and dogs, and a thick fog had enveloped the mountain peaks. Thus, I could no longer see the faces of those mighty friends. Still, I could penetrate their veils of mist and search for them in their smoky shelters. What was rain or storm? My mule was brought to the door, and I decided to climb to the summit of Montanvert. I remembered the impact on my mind of my first sight of the gigantic, ever-moving glacier. A sublime enthusiasm had filled me, lifting my spirit and carrying it from an unknown world to light and joy. The grandeur and majesty in nature had always soothed my mind, making me forget the fleeting troubles of life. Since I knew the path well and another person's presence would spoil the desolate splendor of the scenery, I decided to go without a guide.
es_translation: —Dear cousin —he said to me—, do you see how much happiness you spread when you are cheerful? Don't relapse again! The next morning dawned with a torrential rain, and a thick fog obscured the mountain peaks. I got up early, but I felt melancholic. The rain depressed me; my usual state of mind returned, and I felt sorrowful. I knew that this sudden change would sadden my father and I preferred to avoid it until I had recovered enough to be able to hide these feelings that dominated me. I assumed they would spend the day at the lodge, and since I was used to the rain, humidity, and cold, I decided to go alone to the top of Montanvert[58]. I remembered the impression that the immense, constantly moving glacier had made on me the first time I saw it. Then I had been filled with an ecstasy that lent wings to the spirit, allowing it to detach from the world of darkness and soar towards light and happiness. The contemplation of all that is majestic and awe-inspiring in nature has always had the virtue of ennobling my feelings and has made me forget the ephemeral worries of life. I decided to go alone, for I knew the way well, and the presence of another would have destroyed the grand solitude of the place.

en: “I expected this reception,” said the dæmon. “All men hate the wretched; how, then, must I be hated, who am miserable beyond all living things! Yet you, my creator, detest and spurn me, thy creature, to whom thou art bound by ties only dissoluble by the annihilation of one of us. You purpose to kill me. How dare you sport thus with life? Do your duty towards me, and I will do mine towards you and the rest of mankind. If you will comply with my conditions, I will leave them and you at peace; but if you refuse, I will glut the maw of death, until it be satiated with the blood of your remaining friends.”
vi: “Tôi đã chờ đợi một sự đón tiếp như thế này,” tên ác thần nói. “Người đời vốn ghét kẻ khốn nạn, mà tôi thì là kẻ thảm hại hơn tất cả các sinh vật sống, vậy thì tôi còn bị ghét đến đâu! Nhưng ngài, kẻ đã sáng tạo ra tôi, mà lại kinh tởm và hắt hủi tôi, tạo vật của ngài, đã ràng buộc với ngài bởi những mối dây chỉ tiêu tan được khi một trong hai ta diệt vong. Ngài hạ quyết tâm thủ tiêu tôi. Làm sao ngài dám đem sự sống ra mà đùa giỡn như vậy được? Hãy thực hiện những bổn phận của ngài đối với tôi, và tôi sẽ thực hiện phần mình đối với ngài và phần còn lại của nhân loại. Nếu ngài thuận theo những điều kiện của tôi, tôi sẽ để yên cho họ và ngài; nhưng nếu ngài từ khước, tôi sẽ đem dâng bữa tiệc tận mõm tử thần, cho đến khi hắn no nê vì máu của các bạn hữu còn lại của ngài mới thôi.”
tr: “Bu karşılamayı bekliyordum,” dedi iblis. “Hilkat garibelerinden herkes nefret eder, benim gibi sefillerin sefili birinden nasıl nefret edilmesin ki! Yaratıcım olan sen bile yalnızca ikimizden birinin ortadan kalkmasıyla kopacak olan bağlarla bağlandığın bu yaratığından tiksiniyor, onu hiçe sayıyorsun, öldürmek istiyorsun beni. Oysa ne cüretle böbürlenirsin kendi hayatınla? Bana karşı görevlerini yerine getir ki ben de sana ve insanlığın geri kalanına karşı görevlerimi yerine getireyim. Koşullarıma uyarsan, onları ve seni rahat bırakırım. Ama olur da uymazsan, ölümün kursağını geriye kalan dostlarının kanıyla tıka basa doldururum.
es: —Esperaba este recibimiento —dijo el demoníaco ser—. Todos los hombres odian a los desgraciados. ¡Cuánto, pues, se me debe odiar a mí que soy el más infeliz de los seres vivientes! Sin embargo, vos, creador mío[61], me detestáis y me despreciáis, a mí, vuestra criatura, a quien estáis unido por lazos que sólo la aniquilación de uno de nosotros romperán. Os proponéis matarme. ¿Cómo os atrevéis a jugar así con la vida? Cumplid vuestras obligaciones para conmigo, y yo cumpliré las mías para con vos y el resto de la humanidad. Si aceptáis mis condiciones, os dejaré a vos y a ellos; pero si rehusáis, llenaré hasta saciarlo el buche de la muerte con la sangre de tus amigos.
vi_translation: “I have been waiting for such a reception,” the evil god said. “People naturally hate the wretched, and I am the most miserable of all living creatures, so how much more am I hated! But you, who created me, loathe and shun me, your creation, bound to you by ties that can only be dissolved when one of us perishes. You are determined to destroy me. How dare you play with life in such a way? Fulfill your duties to me, and I will fulfill mine to you and the rest of humanity. If you comply with my conditions, I will leave them and you in peace; but if you refuse, I will offer a feast to the jaws of death, until he is sated with the blood of your remaining friends.”
tr_translation: “I expected this reception,” said the demon. “Everyone hates freaks of nature, how could they not hate someone as wretched as me! Even you, my creator, are disgusted by this creature bound to you by ties that can only be severed by the death of one of us, you disregard it, you want to kill me. Yet with what audacity do you boast of your own life? Fulfill your duties towards me so that I may fulfill mine towards you and the rest of humanity. If you comply with my conditions, I will leave them and you in peace. But if you do not, I will gorge death with the blood of your remaining friends.”
es_translation: —I expected this reception —said the demonic being—. All men hate the wretched. How much, then, must I be hated, I who am the most miserable of all living beings! Yet you, my creator[61], detest and despise me, your creature, to whom you are bound by ties that only the annihilation of one of us will break. You intend to kill me. How dare you play thus with life? Fulfill your obligations to me, and I will fulfill mine to you and the rest of humanity. If you accept my conditions, I will leave you and them alone; but if you refuse, I will fill to the brim the maw of death with the blood of your friends.

en: “Abhorred monster! Fiend that thou art! The tortures of hell are too mild a vengeance for thy crimes. Wretched devil! You reproach me with your creation, come on, then, that I may extinguish the spark which I so negligently bestowed.”
vi: “Con quái vật kinh tởm! Đồ quỷ dữ! Mọi tra tấn dưới âm ty địa ngục cũng còn quá nhẹ đối với tội ác của mi. Ác quỷ khốn nạn! Mi oán trách ta đã sinh ra mi, vậy thì, lại đây, ta sẽ dập tắt tia lửa mà ta đã quá cẩu thả ban xuống.”
tr: “İğrenç canavar! Şeytanın ta kendisisin sen! Cehennem ateşi yetmez senin günahlarına.
es: —¡Aborrecible monstruo!, ¡demonio infame!, los tormentos del infierno son un castigo demasiado suave para tus crímenes. ¡Diablo inmundo!, me reprochas haberte creado; acércate, y déjame apagar la llama que con tanta imprudencia encendí.
vi_translation: "You disgusting monster! You devil!" "All the tortures of hell are too light for your crimes." "Wretched fiend! You blame me for creating you, then come here, I will extinguish the spark I so carelessly bestowed."
tr_translation: "Disgusting monster! You are the devil himself! The fires of hell are not enough for your sins. Vile demon! So you approach me citing your creation; let me extinguish that spark I thoughtlessly granted you and see what happens!"
es_translation: —Abominable monster!, infamous demon!, the torments of hell are too mild a punishment for your crimes. Foul devil!, you reproach me for having created you; come closer, and let me extinguish the flame that I so recklessly ignited.

en: “Being thus provided, I resolved to reside in this hovel until something should occur which might alter my determination. It was indeed a paradise compared to the bleak forest, my former residence, the rain-dropping branches, and dank earth. I ate my breakfast with pleasure and was about to remove a plank to procure myself a little water when I heard a step, and looking through a small chink, I beheld a young creature, with a pail on her head, passing before my hovel. The girl was young and of gentle demeanour, unlike what I have since found cottagers and farmhouse servants to be. Yet she was meanly dressed, a coarse blue petticoat and a linen jacket being her only garb; her fair hair was plaited but not adorned: she looked patient yet sad. I lost sight of her, and in about a quarter of an hour she returned bearing the pail, which was now partly filled with milk. As she walked along, seemingly incommoded by the burden, a young man met her, whose countenance expressed a deeper despondence. Uttering a few sounds with an air of melancholy, he took the pail from her head and bore it to the cottage himself. She followed, and they disappeared. Presently I saw the young man again, with some tools in his hand, cross the field behind the cottage; and the girl was also busied, sometimes in the house and sometimes in the yard.
vi: Được cung cấp đầy đủ như thế, tôi quyết định trú ngụ trong cái chuồng này, khi chưa có điều gì buộc tôi phải thay đổi ý mình. Nơi đây quả thật thiên đường, so với rừng thẳm nơi ở cũ của tôi, nền là đất ẩm, trên đầu thì mưa rỏ xuống từ cành lá. Tôi ăn bữa sáng đầy mãn nguyện, và định dỡ một tấm ván để lấy nước uống thì nghe có tiếng bước chân; và nhìn qua kẽ hở tôi thấy một sinh vật nhỏ đi qua cái ổ của mình, đầu đội cái xô. Cô gái còn rất trẻ, dáng điệu yêu kiều, khác hẳn đám nông dân và người ở trong trang trại mà sau này tôi gặp. Tuy thế cô mặc rất nghèo nàn, trang phục chỉ có mỗi chiếc váy lót thô màu xanh với một áo ngắn bằng len; mái tóc sáng được tết thành bím, nhưng chẳng tô điểm kiểu cách gì; trông cô điềm đạm nhưng buồn bã. Cô đi khỏi tầm mắt tôi, nhưng mười lăm phút sau quay lại, mang theo cái xô đầy lưng sữa, có vẻ khó khăn. Vừa lúc đó một anh thanh niên xuất hiện, nét mặt còn biểu lộ nỗi chán nản sâu xa hơn. Thốt ra vài tiếng nghe ai oán, anh nhấc xô sữa trên đầu cô gái rồi tự mình mang vào nhà. Cô gái đi theo, cả hai mất hút. Sau đó tôi lại trông thấy chàng trai, tay cầm mấy thứ dụng cụ gì đó, đi băng qua cánh đồng sau nhà cô gái cũng tất bật làm việc, lúc thì trong nhà, lúc thì ngoài sân.
tr: İhtiyaçlarımı bu şekilde karşılayınca, kararımı değiştirecek herhangi bir şey olana kadar bu ağılda kalmaya karar verdim. Burası eski yurdum olan kasvetli ormana, yağmur sızdıran dallara ve ıslak toprağa kıyasla gerçekten de cennet gibiydi. Kahvaltımı keyifle etmiş, biraz su alabilmek için bir kütüğü kaldırmak üzereydim ki ayak sesleri duydum. Küçük bir oyuktan bakınca başının üstünde kova taşıyan bir kızın ağılımın yanından geçtiğini gördüm. Bu gencecik bir kızdı ve o âna kadar gördüğüm köylüler ile çiftlik evindeki hizmetçilerden farklı olarak çok nazik görünümlüydü. Ancak kıyafeti kaba sabaydı; kötü bir kumaştan mavi bir etek, keten bir ceketten başka bir şey yoktu üstünde. San saçları örgülü, ama sadeydi. Metanetli, ama üzgün bir hali vardı. Derken gözden kayboldu, fakat on beş dakika kadar sonra, bu kez yansına kadar sütle doldurulmuş kovayla yeniden ortaya çıktı. Yükünü besbelli güçlükle taşıyarak yürüdüğü sırada karşısına, yüzünde daha da karamsar bir ifade olan genç bir adam çıktı. Genç adam, dertli dertli iki çift laf ettikten sonra kovayı kızın elinden alarak, kulübeye kendisi taşıdı. Kız da peşinden gitti ve gözden kayboldular. Delikanlı birazdan elinde alet edevatla yine ortaya çıktı ve kulübenin ardındaki tarlayı boydan boya geçti. Kız da kimi zaman ev, kimi zaman da bahçe işleriyle meşgul oluyordu.
es: Así provisto, me dispuse a permanecer en esta choza hasta que ocurriera algo que modificara mi decisión. Comparada con mi anterior morada, el desangelado bosque donde las ramas goteaban lluvia y el suelo estaba mojado, era en verdad un paraíso. Desayuné con fruición, y me disponía a levantar un madero para sacar agua cuando escuché pasos y vi, por una rendija, a una muchacha que, balanceando un cubo en la cabeza, pasaba por delante de mi cobertizo. Era joven y de aspecto dulce, distinta de lo que más tarde he comprobado que son los labriegos y los criados de las granjas. Iba vestida humildemente, con una tosca falda azul y una chaqueta de paño. Sus cabellos rubios estaban trenzados pero no llevaba adornos. Sus facciones revelaban resignación, pero su aspecto era triste. La perdí de vista, pero transcurridos unos quince minutos reapareció con el mismo recipiente, que ahora estaba medio lleno de leche. Mientras andaba, claramente incómoda por el peso, un joven de rostro aún más deprimido se dirigió a su encuentro. Con aire melancólico intercambiaron algunas palabras, y cogiéndole el cubo se lo llevó hasta la casa. Al poco tiempo vi reaparecer al joven con unas herramientas en la mano y cruzar el campo que había detrás de la casa. Asimismo, la joven también estaba ocupada, a veces dentro de la casa y otras en el patio.
vi_translation: Provided with everything like that, I decided to take shelter in this shed, as there was nothing forcing me to change my mind yet. This place is truly a paradise compared to the deep forest where I used to live, with a damp ground and rain dripping from the branches above. I had a satisfying breakfast and was about to remove a plank to get some water when I heard footsteps; peering through the gap, I saw a small creature passing by my nest, carrying a bucket on its head. The girl was very young, graceful in her movements, quite different from the farmers and workers on the farm that I later encountered. However, she was dressed very poorly, wearing only a coarse blue petticoat and a short woolen jacket; her bright hair was braided but without any adornment; she looked calm but sad. She went out of my sight, but fifteen minutes later she returned, carrying a bucket full of milk, seemingly with difficulty. At that moment, a young man appeared, his face showing even deeper despondency. Uttering a few mournful words, he lifted the bucket of milk off the girl's head and carried it into the house himself. The girl followed, and both disappeared from sight. Later, I saw the young man again, holding some tools, crossing the field behind the house while the girl was also busy working, sometimes inside the house, sometimes in the yard.
tr_translation: After meeting my needs in this way, I decided to stay in this barn until something happened to change my decision. This place was truly like paradise compared to the gloomy forest, the rain-leaking branches, and the wet soil of my old home. I had enjoyed my breakfast and was about to lift a log to get some water when I heard footsteps. When I looked through a small hole, I saw a girl carrying a bucket over her head passing by my barn. She was a very young girl and, unlike the villagers and the servants at the farmhouse I had seen until then, she looked very kind. However, her clothing was coarse; she wore nothing but a blue skirt made of poor fabric and a linen jacket. Her blonde hair was braided but simple. She had a resolute but sad demeanor. Then she disappeared from sight, but about fifteen minutes later, she reappeared with a bucket now half-filled with milk. As she walked, clearly struggling to carry her load, a young man with an even more somber expression on his face appeared before her. After saying a few troubled words, the young man took the bucket from her and carried it to the hut himself. The girl followed him and they disappeared from sight. The young man soon reappeared with tools and equipment in hand and crossed the field behind the hut from end to end. The girl was sometimes busy with housework and sometimes with garden work.
es_translation: Thus provided, I prepared to stay in this hut until something happened that would change my decision. Compared to my previous dwelling, the desolate forest where the branches dripped rain and the ground was wet, it was truly a paradise. I had breakfast with relish, and I was about to lift a log to draw water when I heard footsteps and saw, through a crack, a girl who, balancing a bucket on her head, passed in front of my shed. She was young and sweet-looking, different from what I later found out to be the peasants and farmhands. She was humbly dressed, with a coarse blue skirt and a cloth jacket. Her blonde hair was braided but she wore no ornaments. Her features revealed resignation, but her appearance was sad. I lost sight of her, but after about fifteen minutes she reappeared with the same container, now half full of milk. As she walked, clearly uncomfortable with the weight, a young man with an even more depressed face approached her. With a melancholic air, they exchanged a few words, and taking the bucket from her, he carried it to the house. Soon after, I saw the young man reappear with some tools in his hand and cross the field behind the house. Likewise, the young woman was also busy, sometimes inside the house and other times in the yard.

en: “I lay on my straw, but I could not sleep. I thought of the occurrences of the day. What chiefly struck me was the gentle manners of these people, and I longed to join them, but dared not. I remembered too well the treatment I had suffered the night before from the barbarous villagers, and resolved, whatever course of conduct I might hereafter think it right to pursue, that for the present I would remain quietly in my hovel, watching and endeavouring to discover the motives which influenced their actions.
vi: “Tôi nằm trên đệm rơm, nhưng không sao ngủ được, nghĩ hoài đến những sự kiện xảy ra trong ngày. Điều gây ấn tượng nhất cho tôi là tác phong xử sự hòa nhã dịu dàng của mấy con người sống trong nhà; tôi mong được tiếp xúc với họ biết bao, nhưng không dám. Tôi còn nhớ quá rõ đã phải chịu đựng sự đối xử tàn bạo của dân làng hung ác đêm qua ra làm sao, và quyết định cho dù sau này mình có xác định lối cư xử nào là nên theo nhất đi chăng nữa, thì hiện giờ vẫn chỉ nên yên lặng nằm vùng mà quan sát, cố tìm hiểu xem mọi hành động của họ xuất phát từ động cơ nào, thế thôi.
tr: “Samanlarımın üstüne uzandım ama gözümü uyku tutmadı. Gün içinde olanları düşünmeye başladım. Beni özellikle etkileyen şey, bu insanların nazik tavırlarıydı. Aralarına katılmayı çok istiyor, ama cesaret edemiyordum. Bir gece önce saldırgan köylülerden gördüğüm muamele zihnimde hâlâ capcanlıydı. Bundan sonra ne tür bir ilişkiye girmeye karar verirsem vereyim, bir süreliğine sessiz sakin barakamda saklanacak, insanların hareketlerini etkileyen dürtüleri izleyerek anlamaya çalışacaktım.
es: Me tumbé en la paja, pero no conseguí dormir. Repasaba los sucesos del día. Lo que más me chocaba eran los modales cariñosos de aquellas gentes. Recordaba muy bien el trato de los salvajes aldeanos la noche anterior, y decidí que, cualquiera que fuese la actitud que adoptara en el futuro, por el momento permanecería en mi cobertizo, observando e intentando descubrir las razones que motivaban sus actos.
vi_translation: "I lay on the straw mattress, but couldn't sleep, constantly thinking about the events of the day. The thing that impressed me the most was the gentle and courteous behavior of the people living in the house; I longed to interact with them so much, but didn't dare to. I still remember too clearly how I had to endure the brutal treatment of the cruel villagers last night, and decided that no matter what conduct I might determine to follow in the future, for now, I should just quietly observe, trying to understand the motives behind their actions, that's all.
tr_translation: “I lay down on my blankets but couldn't fall asleep. I started thinking about what had happened during the day. What particularly affected me was the gentle manners of these people. I very much wanted to join them, but I didn't have the courage. The treatment I had received from the aggressive villagers the night before was still vivid in my mind. Whatever kind of relationship I decided to enter into from now on, I would hide in my quiet hut for a while, trying to understand the impulses that influenced people's actions by observing them.
es_translation: I lay down on the straw, but I couldn't sleep. I was reviewing the events of the day. What struck me the most were the affectionate manners of those people. I remembered very well the treatment from the savage villagers the night before, and I decided that, whatever attitude I might adopt in the future, for the moment I would remain in my shed, observing and trying to discover the reasons behind their actions.

en: “They were not entirely happy. The young man and his companion often went apart and appeared to weep. I saw no cause for their unhappiness, but I was deeply affected by it. If such lovely creatures were miserable, it was less strange that I, an imperfect and solitary being, should be wretched. Yet why were these gentle beings unhappy? They possessed a delightful house (for such it was in my eyes) and every luxury; they had a fire to warm them when chill and delicious viands when hungry; they were dressed in excellent clothes; and, still more, they enjoyed one another’s company and speech, interchanging each day looks of affection and kindness. What did their tears imply? Did they really express pain? I was at first unable to solve these questions, but perpetual attention and time explained to me many appearances which were at first enigmatic.
vi: Họ cũng không hoàn toàn hạnh phúc. Anh thanh niên và cô gái thường đi riêng ra một chỗ với nhau, và dường như khóc. Tôi không hiểu có lý do gì khiến họ phải thấy bất hạnh; nhưng tôi xúc động nghẹn ngào vì điều đó. Những con người dễ thương đến như thế mà còn bất hạnh thì tôi đây, sinh vật không hoàn chỉnh và đơn côi thế này, có chịu cảnh khốn nạn thì cũng đâu có gì lạ. Nhưng những sinh linh dịu dàng này vì sao mà bất hạnh kia chứ? Họ có ngôi nhà tuyệt vời (dưới mắt tôi) với mọi thứ sang trọng, có lửa sưởi khi rét mướt, có thức ăn thịnh soạn vô chừng khi đói, họ phục sức thật là lộng lẫy, và hơn tất cả, họ sung sướng được ở bên nhau, nghe lời nói của nhau, trao nhau những cái nhìn yêu thương trìu mến mỗi ngày. Những giọt nước mắt kia nghĩa là gì? Liệu có phải nó thực sự biểu lộ nỗi đau, hay là không? Thoạt đầu tôi chịu không giải thích được những điều này, nhưng sự chú ý quan sát liên tục và lâu dài đã giải thích được cho tôi nhiều cảnh tượng mới nhìn tưởng là khó hiểu.
tr: Tam olarak mutlu oldukları söylenemezdi. Genç çocukla kız sık sık bir köşeye çekilip ağlıyorlardı. Mutsuzluklarının nedenini anlayamıyor, ama derinden etkileniyordum. Böylesine hoş insanlar bile mutsuzlarsa, benim gibi zavallı, eşsiz dostsuz birinin perişan olması gerekirdi. iyi ama bu sevgi dolu insanlar neden mutsuzdu? Hoş bir eve (bana öyle görünüyordu) ve her tür konfora sahiptiler. Üşüdüklerinde onları ısıtacak bir ocakları, acıktıklarında yiyebilecek lezzetli yemekleri vardı. Harika giysiler giyiyor, her gün sevgi ve iyilik dolu gözlerle birbirlerine bakıyor, dahası birbirlerinin dostluğundan, sohbetinden keyif alıyorlardı. O halde gözyaşlarının anlamı neydi? Gerçekten acıyı mı ifade ediyordu? İlk başlarda bu soruların cevabını bulmakta zorlandıysam da sonsuz bir dikkatle ve geçen zamanla birlikte, önceleri esrarengiz görünen durumları anlar oldum.
es: Pero no eran del todo dichosos. El joven y su compañera con frecuencia se retiraban, y parecían llorar. No comprendía la causa de su tristeza; pero me afectaba profundamente. Si seres tan hermosos eran desdichados, no era de extrañar que yo, criatura imperfecta y solitaria, también lo fuera. Pero ¿por qué eran infelices aquellas gentes tan bondadosas? Tenían una agradable casa (pues así me parecía) y todas las comodidades; tenían un fuego para calentarlos del frío y deliciosa comida con que saciar su hambre; vestían buenos trajes, y, lo que es más, disfrutaban de su mutua compañía y conversación, intercambiando a diario miradas de afecto y bondad. ¿Qué significaba su llanto? ¿Expresaban sus lágrimas dolor? No podía, al principio, responderme a estas preguntas, pero el tiempo y una sostenida observación me explicaron muchas cosas que a primera vista parecían enigmáticas.
vi_translation: They are not completely happy either. The young man and the girl often go off to a place alone together, and it seems like they cry. I do not understand what reason could make them feel unhappy; but I am deeply moved by it. Such lovely people being unhappy, then for me, an incomplete and lonely creature, to suffer misery is not surprising at all. But why are these gentle beings unhappy? They have a wonderful home (in my eyes) with all the luxuries, a fire to warm them when it's cold, abundant food when they're hungry, they dress splendidly, and above all, they are happy to be together, to hear each other's words, to exchange loving and tender glances every day. What do those tears mean? Do they truly express pain, or not? At first, I couldn't explain these things, but continuous and long-term observation has explained to me many scenes that initially seemed incomprehensible.
tr_translation: It could not be said that they were exactly happy. The young boy and the girl often withdrew to a corner and cried. I couldn't understand the reason for their unhappiness, but I was deeply affected. If such pleasant people were unhappy, then a poor, friendless person like me should have been devastated. But why were these loving people unhappy? They had a nice house (it seemed so to me) and every kind of comfort. They had a stove to warm them when they were cold and delicious food to eat when they were hungry. They wore wonderful clothes, looked at each other every day with eyes full of love and kindness, and moreover, they enjoyed each other's friendship and conversation. So what was the meaning of their tears? Did they really express pain? Although I initially struggled to find the answers to these questions, with infinite attention and the passage of time, I began to understand situations that initially seemed mysterious.
es_translation: But they were not entirely happy. The young man and his companion often withdrew and seemed to cry. I did not understand the cause of their sadness, but it affected me deeply. If such beautiful beings were unhappy, it was no wonder that I, an imperfect and solitary creature, was also unhappy. But why were those kind people so unhappy? They had a pleasant house (or so it seemed to me) and all the comforts; they had a fire to warm them from the cold and delicious food to satisfy their hunger; they wore good clothes, and, moreover, they enjoyed each other's company and conversation, exchanging daily looks of affection and kindness. What did their crying mean? Did their tears express pain? At first, I could not answer these questions, but time and sustained observation explained many things to me that at first seemed enigmatic.

en: “The pleasant showers and genial warmth of spring greatly altered the aspect of the earth. Men who before this change seemed to have been hid in caves dispersed themselves and were employed in various arts of cultivation. The birds sang in more cheerful notes, and the leaves began to bud forth on the trees. Happy, happy earth! Fit habitation for gods, which, so short a time before, was bleak, damp, and unwholesome. My spirits were elevated by the enchanting appearance of nature; the past was blotted from my memory, the present was tranquil, and the future gilded by bright rays of hope and anticipations of joy.”
vi: Mùa xuân với những cơn mưa rào dịu nhẹ và không khí ấm áp thần tiên làm bộ mặt trái đất có những thay đổi lớn lao. Con người, trước đó dường như vẫn đang ẩn mình trong hang động, trước sự thay đổi đó tỏa cả ra ngoài, và tíu tít thực hiện các thủ thuật khác nhau của nghề trồng trọt. Chim chóc cất tiếng hân hoan hơn, lá non đâm chồi nảy lộc. Mặt đất hạnh phúc, biết bao hạnh phúc! nơi ở dành cho các đấng thánh thần, nơi vừa mới đây còn ẩm thấp, trống trải và độc địa. Tinh thần tôi phấn chấn hẳn lên trước cảnh thiên nhiên đầy mê đắm; quá khứ mờ đi trong tâm thức tôi, hiện tại thật an bình, tương lai lấp lánh những tia hy vọng rực rỡ và dự cảm về niềm vui đang chờ đợi.”
tr: Baharın tatlı sağanakları ve ılık havası yeryüzünün çehresini büyük ölçüde değiştirdi. Bu değişimden önce adeta mağaralarına çekilmiş hissi uyandıran insanlar ortalığa dökülmüş, çeşitli tarım işleriyle uğraşıyorlardı. Kuşlar daha bir neşeyle şakıyor, ağaçların dalları tohumlanıyordu. Ah, güzelim dünya! Daha dün kasvetli, ıslak ve çirkin görünürken şimdi tanrılara layık bir mekâna dönüşüvermişti. Doğanın bu büyüleyici görünümü benim de moralimi yükseltmişti. Geçmiş hafızamdan silinmiş, sükûnete bürünmüş, gelecek ise umut ve sevinç beklentisiyle ışıldamaya başlamıştı.
es: Las suaves lluvias y el calor de la primavera cambiaron mucho el aspecto del terreno. Los hombres, que parecían haber estado escondidos en cuevas, se dispersaron por doquier y se dedicaban a los más diversos cultivos. Los pájaros trinaban con mayor alegría, y las hojas empezaron a despuntar en las ramas. ¡Gozosa, gozosa tierra!, digna morada de los dioses y que aún ayer aparecía insana, húmeda y desolada. Este resurgimiento de la naturaleza me elevó el espíritu; el pasado se me borró de la memoria, el presente era tranquilo y el futuro me daba esperanza y promesas de alegría.
vi_translation: Spring, with its gentle showers and enchanting warm air, brings about significant changes to the face of the earth. People, who previously seemed to be hiding in caves, now come out in response to these changes, busily engaging in various agricultural practices. Birds sing more joyfully, and young leaves sprout and grow. The earth is happy, so happy! It becomes a dwelling place for the divine, a place that was recently damp, barren, and desolate. My spirit is uplifted by the captivating natural scenery; the past fades in my mind, the present is peaceful, and the future sparkles with bright rays of hope and the anticipation of awaiting joy.
tr_translation: The sweet showers and warm air of spring greatly changed the face of the earth. Before this change, people who seemed to have retreated into their caves had come out and were busy with various agricultural tasks. Birds were chirping more cheerfully, and the branches of the trees were seeding. Ah, beautiful world! Just yesterday, it looked gloomy, wet, and ugly, but now it had transformed into a place worthy of the gods. This enchanting appearance of nature had also lifted my spirits. The past had been erased from my memory, enveloped in tranquility, and the future had begun to shine with the expectation of hope and joy."
es_translation: The gentle rains and the warmth of spring greatly changed the appearance of the land. The men, who seemed to have been hiding in caves, scattered everywhere and engaged in the most diverse farming activities. The birds sang more joyfully, and the leaves began to sprout on the branches. Joyful, joyful land!, worthy abode of the gods and which only yesterday appeared unhealthy, damp, and desolate. This resurgence of nature lifted my spirit; the past was erased from my memory, the present was peaceful, and the future gave me hope and promises of joy.

en: “In the meanwhile also the black ground was covered with herbage, and the green banks interspersed with innumerable flowers, sweet to the scent and the eyes, stars of pale radiance among the moonlight woods; the sun became warmer, the nights clear and balmy; and my nocturnal rambles were an extreme pleasure to me, although they were considerably shortened by the late setting and early rising of the sun, for I never ventured abroad during daylight, fearful of meeting with the same treatment I had formerly endured in the first village which I entered.
vi: Trong thời gian này mặt đất đen đã phủ đầy cỏ, hai bờ sông xanh thắm điểm cơ man nào là hoa, cả tai và mắt đều được say sưa thưởng ngoạn, ánh sao xanh nhạt tỏa xuống giữa khu rừng loáng ánh trăng; mặt trời ấm hơn, đêm trong vắt và ngát hương; những cuộc chơi đêm của tôi thích thú vô cùng, tuy đã bị rút ngắn lại vì mặt trời mọc sớm mà lặn muộn, bởi ban ngày tôi vẫn chưa dám thò mặt ra, sợ lại gặp phải cách đối xử tôi từng chịu đựng ở ngôi làng đầu tiên mình đặt chân vào.
