tr: Bu arada kara toprak yeşillere büründü, kokusu hoş, görünümü hoş, binbir türlü çiçek yemyeşil bayırlara yayıldı, soluk ışıklı yıldızlarsa ay ışıklı ormanlara saçıldı. Güneş artık iyice ısıtıyor, geceler sakin ve ılık geçiyordu. Güneşin geç batışı ve erken doğuşuyla birlikte süreleri kısalmış olsa da gece gezintilerim bana büyük bir keyif vermeye başlamıştı. Köye ilk girdiğimde maruz kaldığım muameleyle karşılaşmaktan korktuğum için gündüz vakti dışarıda hiç dolaşmıyordum.
es: Entretanto, la oscura tierra se iba cubriendo de verdor, salpicado de innumerables flores de dulce aroma y maravillosa vista, como estrellas que brillaban con delicado color a la luz de la luna. El sol fue calentando más, y las noches se hicieron claras y suaves. Mis paseos nocturnos me causaban enorme placer, a pesar de que se vieron acortados por las tardías puestas de sol y el temprano amanecer. Nunca me atrevía a salir durante el día, temeroso de recibir el mismo trato que en la primera aldea en la que estuve.
vi_translation: During this time, the black earth was covered with grass, the two riverbanks were lush with countless flowers, both ears and eyes were delighted to enjoy the scenery, the pale blue stars shone down through the forest illuminated by moonlight; the sun was warmer, the nights were clear and fragrant; my nighttime adventures were extremely enjoyable, although they were shortened because the sun rose early and set late, as during the day I still did not dare to show my face, fearing the treatment I had endured in the first village I set foot in.
tr_translation: Meanwhile, the black soil was covered in greenery, with a pleasant scent and appearance, a myriad of flowers spread across the lush green hills, and the faintly lit stars scattered over the moonlit forests. The sun was now warming up well, and the nights were passing calm and mild. Even though the duration of my nightly walks had shortened due to the late sunset and early sunrise, they had started to bring me great pleasure. Because I feared encountering the treatment I faced when I first entered the village, I never wandered outside during the daytime.
es_translation: Meanwhile, the dark earth was becoming covered with greenery, dotted with countless flowers of sweet aroma and marvelous sight, like stars shining with delicate color in the moonlight. The sun grew warmer, and the nights became clear and gentle. My nocturnal walks gave me enormous pleasure, despite being shortened by the late sunsets and early dawns. I never dared to go out during the day, fearful of receiving the same treatment as in the first village I stayed in.

en: “While I improved in speech, I also learned the science of letters as it was taught to the stranger, and this opened before me a wide field for wonder and delight.
vi: Đồng thời với tiến bộ trong lời nói, tôi cũng học được tri thức về chữ viết, bởi họ dạy cả điều đó cho cô gái kia, thành thử trước mắt tôi mở ra cả một miền rộng rãi đầy ngạc nhiên và lý thú.
tr: Bir yandan konuşmamı geliştirirken bir yandan da yabancıya öğretilen harf sanatını kavradım ve bu da önümde merak ve keyif dolu koskocaman bir alan açtı.
es: Puedo presumir de que aprendía a más velocidad que la muchacha árabe, que entendía muy poco y hablaba con acento entrecortado, mientras que yo comprendía todo y podía reproducir casi todas las palabras.
vi_translation: At the same time as making progress in speech, I also learned the knowledge of writing, because they taught that girl as well, thus opening up before my eyes a vast and fascinating realm.
tr_translation: While improving my speech on one hand, I also grasped the art of letters taught to foreigners, which opened up a vast field of curiosity and enjoyment before me.
es_translation: I can boast that I was learning faster than the Arab girl, who understood very little and spoke with a halting accent, while I understood everything and could reproduce almost all the words.

en: “He did not succeed. They remained confined for five months before the trial took place, the result of which deprived them of their fortune and condemned them to a perpetual exile from their native country.
vi: Chàng đã không thành công. Hai người vẫn bị giam thêm năm tháng trước khi tòa xử; họ bị kết án tước hết tài sản và lưu đày khỏi quê hương vĩnh viễn.
tr: Ancak işler umduğu gibi yürümedi. Babasıyla kardeşi mahkeme görülene kadar beş ay hapis yattılar, mahkeme sonunda ise mal varlıkları ellerinden alınarak ülkelerinden sürüldüler.
es: No fue así. Hubieron de permanecer cinco meses en la cárcel antes de que tuviera lugar el juicio que les arrebataría toda su fortuna y les condenaría al destierro.
vi_translation: He did not succeed. The two were still imprisoned for five more months before the trial; they were sentenced to be stripped of all their property and exiled from their homeland forever.
tr_translation: However, things did not go as he had hoped. His father and brother were imprisoned for five months until the trial, and at the end of the trial, their assets were confiscated and they were exiled from their country.
es_translation: It was not so. They had to remain five months in jail before the trial took place that would strip them of all their fortune and condemn them to exile.

en: “‘They are kind—they are the most excellent creatures in the world; but, unfortunately, they are prejudiced against me. I have good dispositions; my life has been hitherto harmless and in some degree beneficial; but a fatal prejudice clouds their eyes, and where they ought to see a feeling and kind friend, they behold only a detestable monster.’
vi: ‘Họ tử tế lắm - họ là những con người tuyệt vời nhất trên đời này, nhưng không may, họ có thành kiến với tôi. Tôi có những tính tình tốt đẹp; đời tôi từ xưa đến nay chưa làm hại ai, ở mức độ nào đó còn làm lợi cho người khác; nhưng ác thay một định kiến tai hại đã làm mờ mắt họ, và lẽ ra họ cần nhìn ra một người bạn tốt nhạy cảm, thì lại chỉ thấy một con quái vật đáng ghê tởm.
tr: ‘İyi yürekli oldukları doğru. Dünyanın en güzel insanları onlar. Ancak maalesef bana karşı peşin hükümlüler. İyi mizaçlı biriyimdir ben. Şimdiye kadar zararsız, hatta bir nebze de faydalı bir hayat sürdüm. Lâkin ölümcül bir peşin hüküm gözlerini kör etmiş onların. O sebeple de karşılarında duygulu, iyi bir dost göreceklerine, sadece iğrenç bir canavar görüyorlar,’ dedim.
es: —Son muy amables; no puede haber personas mejores en el mundo, pero por desgracia recelan de mí aunque mis intenciones son buenas. Nunca he hecho daño a nadie, por el contrario, siempre he tratado de aportar mi ayuda. Pero un prejuicio fatal los obnubila, y en lugar de ver en mí a un amigo lleno de sensibilidad me consideran un monstruo detestable.
vi_translation: ‘They are very kind - they are the most wonderful people in this world, but unfortunately, they are prejudiced against me. I have good qualities; my life has never harmed anyone, to some extent it has even benefited others; but alas, a harmful prejudice has blinded them, and where they should have seen a sensitive good friend, they only saw a monstrous abomination.’
tr_translation: ‘It is true that they are kind-hearted. They are the most beautiful people in the world. However, unfortunately, they are prejudiced against me. I am a good-natured person. So far, I have led a harmless, even somewhat beneficial life. But a deadly prejudice has blinded them. Therefore, instead of seeing a sensitive, good friend in front of them, they only see a disgusting monster,’ I said.
es_translation: —They are very kind; there cannot be better people in the world, but unfortunately, they are suspicious of me even though my intentions are good. I have never harmed anyone; on the contrary, I have always tried to offer my help. But a fatal prejudice blinds them, and instead of seeing in me a friend full of sensitivity, they consider me a detestable monster.

en: “‘I am about to undertake that task; and it is on that account that I feel so many overwhelming terrors. I tenderly love these friends; I have, unknown to them, been for many months in the habits of daily kindness towards them; but they believe that I wish to injure them, and it is that prejudice which I wish to overcome.’
vi: ‘Tôi sắp làm việc đó đây, và chính đó là nguyên do tôi cảm thấy hãi hùng rợn người đến vậy. Tôi yêu tha thiết những người bạn của tôi; nhiều tháng nay, tôi đã quen chăm sóc họ hàng ngày, mà họ hoàn toàn không biết; nhưng họ tin rằng tôi muốn làm hại họ, và đó chính là thành kiến tôi muốn vượt qua.
tr: ‘Benim niyetim de o zaten. Tam da bu sebepten içimi binbir türlü korku sarmış halde. Bu dostları canı yürekten seviyorum. Farkında değiller, ama aylardır her günümü onlara iyilikle geçiriyorum. Halbuki onlar canlarını yakarım sanıyorlar. İşte bu peşin hükmün üstesinden gelmek istiyorum.
es: —Estoy a punto de iniciar esa tarea, y es justamente por ello por lo que siento tantos temores. Tengo un gran cariño por estos amigos. Durante muchos meses, y sin que ellos lo sepan, les he venido prestando cotidianamente algunos pequeños servicios, no obstante piensan que quiero perjudicarlos. Es precisamente ese prejuicio el que quiero vencer.
vi_translation: ‘I am about to do it, and that is precisely why I feel so horrified and terrified. I love my friends dearly; for many months, I have been accustomed to taking care of them every day without their knowledge; but they believe that I want to harm them, and that is the prejudice I want to overcome.’
tr_translation: ‘That's exactly my intention. For this very reason, I am filled with all kinds of fears. I love these friends with all my heart. They are not aware, but I have been spending every day for months doing good for them. However, they think I will hurt them. This is the prejudice I want to overcome.'
es_translation: —I am about to start that task, and it is precisely because of this that I feel so many fears. I have great affection for these friends. For many months, and without them knowing, I have been providing them with some small services daily, yet they think I want to harm them. It is precisely that prejudice that I want to overcome.

en: “Cursed, cursed creator! Why did I live? Why, in that instant, did I not extinguish the spark of existence which you had so wantonly bestowed? I know not; despair had not yet taken possession of me; my feelings were those of rage and revenge. I could with pleasure have destroyed the cottage and its inhabitants and have glutted myself with their shrieks and misery.
vi: “Kẻ sáng tạo trăm ngàn lần đáng nguyền rủa! Tôi còn sống làm gì nữa không biết? Tại sao trong khoảnh khắc đó tôi không dập tắt ngay tia lửa của cuộc đời mà ngài đã ban tặng? Tôi cũng không biết nữa; tuyệt vọng chưa hoàn toàn chiếm được tôi; cảm giác của tôi lúc đó chỉ là căm giận và muốn trả thù. Lẽ ra tôi đã tìm khoái lạc bằng cách đập tan ngôi nhà cùng những kẻ đang sống trong đó, và tự thỏa mãn bằng tiếng la lối và cảnh khốn đốn của họ.
tr: “Kahrolası, kahrolası yaratıcı! Ne diye yaşıyordum ki ben? Niçin düşüncesizce bahşettiğin yaşam kıvılcımını o anda yok edivermemiştim? Bilemiyorum. Henüz çaresizliğe teslim olmamıştım sanırım. Hissettiklerim yalnızca öfke ve intikamdı. O kulübeyi ve sakinlerini büyük bir zevkle yerle bir edebilir, feryatları ve ıstıraplarıyla iştahımı köreltebilirdim.
es: ¡Maldito, maldito creador! ¿Por qué tuve que vivir? ¿Por qué no apagué en ese instante la llama de vida que tú tan inconscientemente habías encendido? No lo sé; aún no se había apoderado de mí la desesperación; experimentaba sólo sentimientos de ira y venganza. Con gusto hubiera destruido la casa y sus habitantes, y sus alaridos y su desgracia me hubieran saciado.
vi_translation: “The creator is cursed a hundred thousand times! Why am I still alive, I don't know? Why in that moment did I not extinguish the spark of life that you bestowed upon me? I don't know either; despair had not completely overtaken me; my feeling at that moment was only anger and a desire for revenge. I should have found pleasure in destroying the house along with those living in it, and satisfied myself with their screams and their misery.
tr_translation: “Damn, damn creator! Why was I even living? Why hadn't I extinguished the spark of life you thoughtlessly bestowed upon me at that moment? I don't know. I suppose I had not yet surrendered to despair. All I felt was anger and revenge. I could have destroyed that hut and its inhabitants with great pleasure, satiating my appetite with their cries and suffering.
es_translation: Damned, damned creator! Why did I have to live? Why did I not extinguish in that instant the flame of life that you so thoughtlessly had ignited? I do not know; despair had not yet taken hold of me; I was experiencing only feelings of anger and vengeance. Gladly would I have destroyed the house and its inhabitants, and their screams and their misfortune would have satisfied me.

en: “But this was a luxury of sensation that could not endure; I became fatigued with excess of bodily exertion and sank on the damp grass in the sick impotence of despair. There was none among the myriads of men that existed who would pity or assist me; and should I feel kindness towards my enemies? No: from that moment I declared everlasting war against the species, and more than all, against him who had formed me and sent me forth to this insupportable misery.
vi: Nhưng cảm giác chất chứa nhiều đến thế không thể dài lâu; mệt mỏi vì sức lực dốc ra, tôi ngồi bệt xuống cỏ ướt trong sự bất lực tuyệt vọng đến lả người. Ngàn vạn con người đang tồn tại chẳng có lấy một ai thương xót tôi, giúp đỡ tôi; vậy thì sao tôi phải đem lòng tử tế đối đãi kẻ thù? Không đời nào; từ khoảnh khắc đó tôi tuyên chiến vĩnh viễn với giống người, và trên nhất, với kẻ đã tạo nên tôi và đưa tôi đến nỗi bất hạnh không cách gì chịu nổi này.
tr: Ancak bunlar uzun sürmesi imkânsız duygulardı. Sonunda yorgunluktan bitap düşerek ümitsizliğin hastalıklı acizliği içinde ıslak otların üstüne yığıldım. Onca insan arasında bana merhamet edip yardım elini uzatacak tek kimse yokken, ben mi düşmanlarıma sevgi besleyecektim? Hayır, o andan itibaren insan ırkına, özellikle de beni şekillendirip bu dayanılmaz ıstırabın ortasına yollayan kişiye karşı savaş ilan ettim.
es: Pero era una sensación que no podía durar; pronto el exceso de este esfuerzo corporal me fatigó, y me senté en la hierba húmeda, sumido en la impotencia de la desesperación. No había uno de entre los millones de hombres en la Tierra que se compadeciera de mí y me auxiliara. ¿Debía yo entonces sentir bondad hacia mis enemigos? ¡No! Desde aquel momento declararía una guerra sin fin contra la especie, y en particular contra aquel que me había creado y obligado a sufrir esta insoportable desdicha.
vi_translation: But the feeling of being so overwhelmed could not last long; exhausted from the effort, I sat down on the wet grass in utter despair, completely drained. Thousands of people are living without a single one showing me any compassion or helping me; so why should I treat my enemies kindly? Never; from that moment on, I declared eternal war on mankind, and above all, on the one who created me and brought me to this unbearable misery.
tr_translation: However, these were feelings that were impossible to sustain for long. In the end, exhausted and worn out, I collapsed onto the wet grass in the sickly impotence of despair. Among so many people, with no one to show me mercy and extend a helping hand, was I supposed to harbor love for my enemies? No, from that moment on, I declared war on the human race, especially on the person who shaped me and sent me into this unbearable agony.
es_translation: But it was a feeling that could not last; soon the excess of this physical effort fatigued me, and I sat on the damp grass, sunk in the helplessness of despair. There was not one among the millions of men on Earth who would pity me and help me. Should I then feel kindness towards my enemies? No! From that moment on, I would declare an endless war against the species, and particularly against the one who had created me and forced me to suffer this unbearable misery.

en: “As the night advanced, a fierce wind arose from the woods and quickly dispersed the clouds that had loitered in the heavens; the blast tore along like a mighty avalanche and produced a kind of insanity in my spirits that burst all bounds of reason and reflection. I lighted the dry branch of a tree and danced with fury around the devoted cottage, my eyes still fixed on the western horizon, the edge of which the moon nearly touched. A part of its orb was at length hid, and I waved my brand; it sank, and with a loud scream I fired the straw, and heath, and bushes, which I had collected. The wind fanned the fire, and the cottage was quickly enveloped by the flames, which clung to it and licked it with their forked and destroying tongues.
vi: Đêm khuya hơn nữa, một cơn gió mạnh nổi lên từ rừng thẳm xua tan hết những mây trên trời; đợt gió bốc qua như một cơn tuyết lở khiến tinh thần tôi trở nên cuồng dại, thủ tiêu mọi ranh giới của lý trí và suy tưởng. Tôi châm lửa vào một cành cây khô, rồi lượn những vòng căm giận quanh ngôi nhà tranh bị kết án hủy diệt, mắt vẫn gắn vào chân trời phía Tây nơi mặt trăng vừa chạm rìa trời. Cuối cùng một phần của tinh cầu cũng khuất đi, tôi khua một vòng cành lửa; rồi quả cầu mất dạng hẳn, và, thét lên một tiếng thật to, tôi châm lửa vào đống rơm, củi và cỏ khô đã đem chất chung quanh. Gió quạt lửa to lên, căn nhà nhanh chóng ngập trong ngọn lửa, lưỡi lửa bám lấy, liếm dần toàn bộ căn nhà để thiêu trụi nó.
tr: Gece ilerledikçe ormandan yükselen şiddetli bir rüzgâr gökte gezinen bulutları dağıttı ve ortalığı muazzam bir çığ gibi yıkarak ruhumda tüm mantık ve düşünce sınırlarını çökerten bir delilik yarattı. Kuru bir dalı tutuşturdum ve ayın kıyısına dokunmaya yüz tuttuğu batı ufkundan gözlerimi ayırmaksızın, canı gönülden sevdiğim kulübenin etrafında öfke içinde dans etmeye başladım. Ay çemberinin bir kısmı nihayet karanlığa gömüldüğünde, alevlenen dalımı salladım, ay tamamen görünmez olduğunda da var gücümle haykırarak, topladığım samanları ve çalı çırpıyı tutuşturdum. Rüzgâr ateşi iyice körükleyince alevler çok geçmeden kulübeyi kuşattı, sıkıca sarmaladı, sivri ve yakıcı diliyle yalamaya başladı.
es: Así que avanzaba la noche, se levantó un fuerte viento desde el bosque, y pronto se dispersaron las nubes que cubrían el cielo. La ventolera fue aumentando hasta que pareció una imponente avalancha, y produjo en mí una especie de demencia que arrasó los límites de la razón. Prendí fuego a una rama seca, y comencé una alocada danza alrededor de la casa, antes tan querida, los ojos fijos en el oeste, donde la luna comenzaba a rozar el horizonte. Parte de la esfera finalmente se ocultó y blandí mi rama; desapareció por completo, y, con un aullido, encendí la paja, los matorrales y arbustos que había colocado. El viento avivó el fuego, y pronto la casa estuvo envuelta en llamas que la lamían ávidamente con sus destructoras y puntiagudas lenguas de fuego[71].
vi_translation: Late at night, a strong wind rose from the deep forest, dispersing all the clouds in the sky; the gust swept through like an avalanche, driving my spirit to madness, erasing all boundaries of reason and thought. I set fire to a dry branch, then circled angrily around the condemned thatched house, my eyes fixed on the western horizon where the moon had just touched the edge of the sky. Finally, a part of the celestial body disappeared, I swung the burning branch in a circle; then the orb vanished entirely, and, with a loud scream, I set fire to the pile of straw, wood, and dry grass that had been gathered around. The wind fanned the flames, the house quickly engulfed in fire, the tongues of flame clinging to and gradually consuming the entire house to ashes.
tr_translation: As the night progressed, a strong wind rising from the forest scattered the clouds wandering in the sky and, like an enormous avalanche, swept through everything, creating a madness in my soul that shattered all boundaries of logic and thought. I lit a dry branch and, without taking my eyes off the western horizon where the moon was about to touch the edge, I began to dance furiously around the cabin I loved with all my heart. When part of the moon's circle finally sank into darkness, I waved my flaming branch, and as the moon became completely invisible, I shouted with all my might and set fire to the straw and twigs I had gathered. As the wind fanned the fire, the flames soon surrounded the cabin, tightly wrapping it, and began to lick it with their sharp and scorching tongues.
es_translation: As the night advanced, a strong wind rose from the forest, and soon the clouds that covered the sky dispersed. The gale kept increasing until it seemed like a mighty avalanche, and it produced in me a kind of madness that swept away the boundaries of reason. I set fire to a dry branch and began a wild dance around the house, once so dear, my eyes fixed on the west, where the moon began to touch the horizon. Part of the sphere finally hid, and I brandished my branch; it disappeared completely, and, with a howl, I set fire to the straw, the bushes, and shrubs that I had placed. The wind fanned the flames, and soon the house was engulfed in flames that licked it eagerly with their destructive and pointed tongues of fire[71].

en: “I generally rested during the day and travelled only when I was secured by night from the view of man. One morning, however, finding that my path lay through a deep wood, I ventured to continue my journey after the sun had risen; the day, which was one of the first of spring, cheered even me by the loveliness of its sunshine and the balminess of the air. I felt emotions of gentleness and pleasure, that had long appeared dead, revive within me. Half surprised by the novelty of these sensations, I allowed myself to be borne away by them, and forgetting my solitude and deformity, dared to be happy. Soft tears again bedewed my cheeks, and I even raised my humid eyes with thankfulness towards the blessed sun, which bestowed such joy upon me.
vi: Thường thường ban ngày tôi tìm chỗ nghỉ ngơi, chỉ lên đường khi đêm che chắn an toàn cho tôi khỏi tầm mắt con người. Tuy thế sáng hôm ấy, thấy con đường chạy qua một khu rừng rậm, tôi cứ liều đi tiếp dù mặt trời đã mọc. Đó là một ngày đầu xuân, ánh nắng đáng yêu quá, không khí ngát hương thơm khiến ngay cả tôi cũng vui vẻ hẳn lên. Tôi cảm thấy những xúc động dịu dàng và dễ chịu bấy lâu tưởng đã chết nay sống lại. Gần như ngạc nhiên vì những tình cảm ấy, tôi cứ để chúng cuốn mình đi; quên cả mình đang cô đơn, dị dạng, tôi còn dám thấy mình hạnh phúc. Nước mắt âm ẩm chảy dài trên má, tôi thậm chí còn ngước đôi mắt ướt lên cảm ơn mặt trời thánh thiện đã ban xuống cho tôi niềm vui đến thế.
tr: Çoğunlukla gündüzleri dinleniyor, görülmeyeceğimden emin olduğum gece saatlerinde ise yol alıyordum. Ancak bir sabah yolum büyük bir ormana düşünce güneş doğduktan sonra da yoluma devam etmeye kalkıştım. Baharın ilk günlerine rastlayan o gün, güneşin sıcaklığıyla havadaki güzel kokular beni bile neşelendirmişti. İçimde uzun süredir hissetmediğim türden hoş ve keyifli hisler uyandı. Biraz da yeniden canlanan bu duyguların verdiği şaşkınlıkla kendimi bırakıverdim ve yalnızlığımı, çirkinliğimi unutarak mutlu olma cüretini gösterdim. Yanaklarımdan bir kez daha ılık yaşlar süzüldü, hatta minnet duygusuyla nemli gözlerimi, bana bu sevinci bahşeden güneşe çevirdim.
es: Solía descansar por el día y viajar de noche, cuando la oscuridad me protegía de cualquier encuentro. Sin embargo, una mañana, viendo que mi ruta cruzaba un espeso bosque, me atreví a continuar mi viaje después del amanecer; era uno de los primeros días de la primavera, y la suavidad del aire y la hermosa luz consiguieron animarme. Sentí revivir en mí olvidadas emociones de dulzura y placer que creía muertas. Medio sorprendido por la novedad de estos sentimientos, me dejé arrastrar por ellos; olvidé mi soledad y deformación, y me atreví a ser feliz. Ardientes lágrimas humedecieron mis mejillas, y alcé los ojos hacia el sol agradeciendo la dicha que me enviaba.
vi_translation: Usually, during the day, I find a place to rest, only hitting the road when the night safely shields me from human eyes. However, that morning, seeing the road running through a dense forest, I took the risk of continuing even though the sun had already risen. It was an early spring day, the sunlight was so lovely, and the air was fragrant, making even me feel cheerful. I felt gentle and pleasant emotions that I had long thought dead come back to life. Almost surprised by these feelings, I let them carry me away; forgetting my loneliness and deformity, I even dared to feel happy. Tears softly streamed down my cheeks, and I even looked up with wet eyes to thank the benevolent sun for granting me such joy.
tr_translation: I mostly rested during the day and traveled at night when I was sure I wouldn't be seen. However, one morning, when my path led me into a large forest, I decided to continue my journey even after the sun had risen. That day, which coincided with the first days of spring, the warmth of the sun and the pleasant scents in the air even made me cheerful. Feelings of pleasure and joy that I hadn't felt in a long time awakened inside me. A bit surprised by these newly revived emotions, I let myself go and dared to be happy, forgetting my loneliness and ugliness. Warm tears once again streamed down my cheeks, and with a sense of gratitude, I even turned my moist eyes towards the sun that had granted me this joy.
es_translation: I used to rest during the day and travel at night, when the darkness protected me from any encounter. However, one morning, seeing that my route crossed a dense forest, I dared to continue my journey after dawn; it was one of the first days of spring, and the softness of the air and the beautiful light managed to cheer me up. I felt forgotten emotions of sweetness and pleasure that I thought were dead revive within me. Half surprised by the novelty of these feelings, I let myself be carried away by them; I forgot my loneliness and deformity, and I dared to be happy. Burning tears moistened my cheeks, and I raised my eyes to the sun, thanking it for the happiness it sent me.

en: “As I fixed my eyes on the child, I saw something glittering on his breast. I took it; it was a portrait of a most lovely woman. In spite of my malignity, it softened and attracted me. For a few moments I gazed with delight on her dark eyes, fringed by deep lashes, and her lovely lips; but presently my rage returned; I remembered that I was for ever deprived of the delights that such beautiful creatures could bestow and that she whose resemblance I contemplated would, in regarding me, have changed that air of divine benignity to one expressive of disgust and affright.
vi: Nhìn kỹ đứa bé tôi thấy trên ngực nó có cái gì lóng lánh. Tôi cầm lên xem; nó là bức chân dung hình một người đàn bà rất đẹp và đáng yêu. Nó làm tôi dịu xuống và mê mải bất chấp cơn thù hận của mình. Suốt một lúc lâu tôi cứ ngắm nhìn thích thú đôi mắt đen nhánh với hàng mi dài cùng đôi môi tuyệt mỹ; song lửa giận lại bùng lên; tôi nhớ ra rằng suốt đời tôi đã bị tước mất niềm vui mà những sinh vật mỹ miều đó mang lại, và khuôn mặt tôi ngắm nhìn kia nếu nhìn trở lại tôi, sẽ chuyển ngay những nét nhân từ thánh thiện kia thành kinh tởm và khiếp hãi.
tr: Gözlerimi çocuğa diktiğimde göğsünde bir şeyin parladığını fark ettim. Eğilip aldım; çok güzel bir kadının portresiydi. Tüm nefretime karşın bu portre beni yumuşattı ve hoşuma gitti. Kadının uzun kirpikleriyle gölgelenen kara gözlerine ve güzel dudaklarına dakikalarca keyifle bakakaldım. Neden sonra öfkem geri döndü. Böyle güzel varlıkların bahşedebileceği mutluluklardan sonsuza kadar mahrum bırakıldığımı ve söz konusu ben olduğumda, güzelliğine hayran kaldığım bu ifadenin ilahi sevecenliğini yitirerek tiksinti ve korkuya dönüşeceğini hatırladım.
es: Mientras miraba a la criatura, vi un objeto que le brillaba sobre el pecho. Lo cogí; era el retrato de una hermosísima mujer. A pesar de mi maldad, me ablandó y me sedujo. Durante unos instantes contemplé los ojos oscuros, bordeados de espesas pestañas, los hermosos labios; pero pronto volvió mi cólera: recordé que me habían privado de los placeres que criaturas como aquella podían proporcionarme; y que la mujer que contemplaba, de verme, hubiera cambiado ese aire de bondad angelical por una expresión de espanto y repugnancia.
vi_translation: Looking closely at the child, I saw something sparkling on its chest. I picked it up to examine; it was a portrait of a very beautiful and lovely woman. It calmed me down and captivated me despite my own hatred. For a long while, I kept admiring the jet-black eyes with long eyelashes and the perfect lips; but then the anger flared up again; I remembered that all my life I had been deprived of the joy that such beautiful creatures bring, and the face I was admiring, if it looked back at me, would instantly transform those kind and holy features into disgust and fear.
tr_translation: When I fixed my eyes on the child, I noticed something shining on his chest. I bent down and picked it up; it was the portrait of a very beautiful woman. Despite all my hatred, this portrait softened me and I liked it. I gazed with pleasure for minutes at the woman's black eyes shaded by long eyelashes and her beautiful lips. After a while, my anger returned. I remembered that I was forever deprived of the happiness that such beautiful beings could bestow and that, when it came to me, the divine tenderness of this expression I admired would turn into disgust and fear.
es_translation: While I was looking at the creature, I saw an object shining on its chest. I grabbed it; it was the portrait of a most beautiful woman. Despite my wickedness, it softened and seduced me. For a few moments, I gazed at the dark eyes, bordered by thick eyelashes, the beautiful lips; but soon my anger returned: I remembered that I had been deprived of the pleasures that creatures like that could provide me; and that the woman I was looking at, upon seeing me, would have changed that air of angelic kindness for an expression of horror and disgust.

en: “While I was overcome by these feelings, I left the spot where I had committed the murder, and seeking a more secluded hiding-place, I entered a barn which had appeared to me to be empty. A woman was sleeping on some straw; she was young, not indeed so beautiful as her whose portrait I held, but of an agreeable aspect and blooming in the loveliness of youth and health. Here, I thought, is one of those whose joy-imparting smiles are bestowed on all but me. And then I bent over her and whispered, ‘Awake, fairest, thy lover is near—he who would give his life but to obtain one look of affection from thine eyes; my beloved, awake!’
vi: Lòng đang ngập tràn những xúc động đó, tôi bèn rời khỏi nơi mình đã gây ra vụ giết người; và trong khi đi tìm một chỗ trú ẩn khác kín đáo hơn, tôi vào một kho thóc tưởng là trống không. Có một cô gái đang nằm ngủ trên đống rơm; cô rất trẻ, thực tình thì không đẹp như bức chân dung tôi đang cầm trên tay, nhưng khá dễ coi, đang tuổi nở rộ sự tươi trẻ và khỏe mạnh. Đây nữa, tôi nghĩ, một trong những người sẽ ban phát những nụ cười truyền hạnh phúc cho tất cả mọi người, trừ ta. Thế là tôi cúi xuống cô ta, thì thào: ‘Tỉnh dậy đi, người đẹp, người yêu nàng đang ở gần ngay đấy thôi; hắn sẵn sàng hy sinh cả đời mình chỉ để nhận được từ đôi mắt nàng một ánh nhìn yêu thương trìu mến, nàng ơi, người ta yêu, hãy tỉnh dậy!
tr: Cinayeti işlediğim yeri işte bu duygularla terk ettim ve daha korunaklı bir yer aramaya başladım. Boş gibi görünen bir ambara girdim. Samanların üstünde uyuyan bir kadın vardı. Genç biriydi ve elimdeki portrenin sahibi kadar olmasa da güzeldi. Tazelik ve sağlıkla ışıldıyordu. İşte mutluluk veren gülümsemelerini benden başka Herkese bahşedenlerden biri daha, diye düşündüm. Sonra da kızın üstüne doğru eğilerek kulağına, ‘Uyan güzeller güzeli, sevdiğin yanında. Şefkat dolu tek bir bakışın için canını vermeye hazır olan sevdiğin geldi. Haydi, uyan canım sevgilim!’ diye fısıldadım.
es: Poseído de estos pensamientos, abandoné el lugar donde había cometido el asesinato, y buscaba un lugar más resguardado para esconderme cuando vi a una mujer que pasaba cerca de mí. Era joven, ciertamente no tan hermosa como aquella cuyo retrato sostenía, pero de aspecto agradable, y tenía el encanto y frescor de la juventud. «He aquí —pensé— una de esas criaturas cuyas sonrisas recibirán todos menos yo; no escapará.
vi_translation: My heart filled with those emotions, I left the place where I had committed the murder; and while searching for another more discreet hiding place, I entered a barn that I thought was empty. There was a girl sleeping on a pile of straw; she was very young, not as beautiful as the portrait I was holding in my hand, but quite attractive, in the prime of youth and health. Here again, I thought, is one of those who will bestow smiles that bring happiness to everyone, except me. So I bent down to her and whispered: ‘Wake up, beautiful, your lover is very near; he is ready to sacrifice his whole life just to receive a loving, affectionate glance from your eyes, my dear, my love, wake up!’
tr_translation: I left the place where I committed the murder with these feelings and started looking for a more secure place. I entered a barn that seemed empty. There was a woman sleeping on the hay. She was young and although not as beautiful as the owner of the portrait in my hand, she was still pretty. She was glowing with freshness and health. Here was another one of those who bestowed their happiness-giving smiles on everyone but me, I thought. Then I leaned over the girl and whispered in her ear, ‘Wake up, beautiful, your beloved is here. Your beloved, who is ready to give his life for a single compassionate glance from you, has come. Come on, wake up my dear love!’
es_translation: Possessed by these thoughts, I left the place where I had committed the murder and was looking for a more sheltered spot to hide when I saw a woman passing near me. She was young, certainly not as beautiful as the one whose portrait I held, but of pleasant appearance, and she had the charm and freshness of youth. “Here,” I thought, “is one of those creatures whose smiles will be received by everyone but me; she will not escape.

en: “For some days I haunted the spot where these scenes had taken place, sometimes wishing to see you, sometimes resolved to quit the world and its miseries for ever. At length I wandered towards these mountains, and have ranged through their immense recesses, consumed by a burning passion which you alone can gratify. We may not part until you have promised to comply with my requisition. I am alone and miserable; man will not associate with me; but one as deformed and horrible as myself would not deny herself to me. My companion must be of the same species and have the same defects. This being you must create.”
vi: Trong mấy ngày liền tôi cứ qua lại nơi đã xảy ra những chuyện kia; có lúc muốn gặp lại ngài, có lúc quyết tâm từ bỏ vĩnh viễn thế giới này cùng những đau khổ của nó. Cuối cùng bước chân đưa tôi đến rặng núi này, và tới giờ tôi đã đi khắp các hẻm các ngách vô tận, trong lòng cháy bỏng niềm đam mê mà chỉ có ngài là người thỏa mãn được. Chúng ta không thể rời bỏ nhau chừng nào ngài không đáp ứng đòi hỏi của tôi. Tôi cô đơn, tôi thảm hại; con người không lai vãng gần tôi, nhưng một kẻ cũng quái dạng, cũng kinh tởm như tôi hẳn sẽ không từ chối tôi đến với cô ta. Cô bạn đồng hành với tôi cũng phải cùng một loại như tôi, có những nhược điểm như tôi. Sinh vật đó ngài cần phải tạo ra.”
tr: Bazen seni görmeyi umarak, bazen de bu dünyayı ve cefasını sonsuza kadar terk etmeyi düşünerek bu olayların yaşandığı yerlerde birkaç gün boyunca dolandım durdum. Nihayetinde bu dağlara geldim ve yalnızca senin (indirebileceğin bir tutkunun ateşiyle yanıp tutuşarak dağların muazzam kuytularında gezindim. Senden şimdi isteyeceğim şeyi gerçekleştireceğine söz verene kadar ayrılmayacağız. Çok yalnız ve mutsuzum. İnsanlar yanıma yanaşmasa da benim kadar korkunç ve çirkin biri benden uzak duramaz. Eşimin de benim türümden olması ve benim kusurlarımı paylaşması şart. İşte onu sen yaratacaksın.
es: A veces deseaba encontrarte, otras estaba decidido a abandonar para siempre este mundo y sus miserias. Por fin me dirigí a estas montañas, por cuyas cavidades he deambulado, consumido por una devoradora pasión que sólo tú puedes satisfacer. No podemos separarnos hasta que no accedas a mi petición. Estoy solo, soy desdichado; nadie quiere compartir mi vida, sólo alguien tan deforme y horrible como yo podría concederme su amor. Mi compañera deberá ser igual que yo, y tener mis mismos defectos. Tú deberás crear este ser.
vi_translation: For several days, I kept going back and forth to the place where those events had occurred; sometimes wanting to meet you again, sometimes determined to forever abandon this world and all its suffering. Finally, my steps brought me to this mountain range, and up to now I have wandered through its endless paths and crevices, my heart burning with a passion that only you can satisfy. We cannot part from each other as long as you do not meet my demands. I am lonely, I am miserable; humans do not come near me, but a creature as monstrous and repulsive as I am surely would not refuse me to come to her. My companion must also be of the same kind as I am, with the same flaws as I have. That creature you must create.
tr_translation: Sometimes wandering around the places where these events took place for a few days, hoping to see you, and sometimes thinking of leaving this world and its suffering forever. Eventually, I came to these mountains and roamed the vast recesses of the mountains, burning with a passion that only you could ignite. We will not part until you promise to fulfill what I am about to ask of you now. I am very lonely and unhappy. Even if people do not approach me, someone as terrifying and ugly as I am cannot stay away from me. It is essential that my mate is of my kind and shares my flaws. You will create her.”
es_translation: Sometimes I wished to find you, other times I was determined to abandon this world and its miseries forever. Finally, I headed to these mountains, through whose cavities I have wandered, consumed by a devouring passion that only you can satisfy. We cannot part until you grant my request. I am alone, I am miserable; no one wants to share my life, only someone as deformed and horrible as I am could grant me their love. My companion must be like me, and have my same defects. You must create this being.

en: “I do refuse it,” I replied; “and no torture shall ever extort a consent from me. You may render me the most miserable of men, but you shall never make me base in my own eyes. Shall I create another like yourself, whose joint wickedness might desolate the world. Begone! I have answered you; you may torture me, but I will never consent.”
vi: “Ta phủ nhận đấy,” tôi đáp, “có tra tấn đến đâu cũng đừng hòng ta chấp thuận. Mi có thể biến ta thành kẻ thảm thương nhất thế gian nhưng không bao giờ khiến được ta trở thành hèn hạ đối với chính ta. Tạo thêm một kẻ khác giống như mi, để cái xấu liên kết lại tàn hại thế giới này ư? Cút! Ta đã trả lời rồi đó, mi cứ hành hạ ta đi, ta không bao giờ đồng ý.”
tr: "Pekala da geri çeviriyorum" dedim. "Şunu bil ki hiçbir eziyet bu fikrimi değiştiremez. Beni insanları en Perişanı durumuna düşürmüş olabilirsin, ama kendi gözümde alçalmamı sağlayamazsın. Senin gibi birini daha yaratayım da, el ele verip zulmünüzle dünyayı harap mı edesiniz? Yıkıl karşımdan! Cevabımı duydun; işkence dahi etsen, razı olmayacağım.
es: —Pues sí, me niego —contesté—, y ninguna tortura conseguirá que acceda. Podrás convertirme en el más desdichado de los hombres, pero no lograrás que me desprecie a mí mismo. ¿Crees que podría crear otro ser como tú, para que uniendo vuestras fuerzas arraséis el mundo? ¡Aléjate! Te he contestado; podrás torturarme, ¡pero jamás consentiré!
vi_translation: “I deny it,” I replied, “no matter how much you torture me, I will never agree. You can turn me into the most miserable person in the world, but you will never make me disgrace myself. Create another one like you, so that evil can unite and destroy this world? Get lost! I have already answered, you can torment me all you want, I will never agree.”
tr_translation: "Alright, then I'm turning back," I said. "Know this, no torment can change my mind. You may have brought me to the most wretched state among people, but you cannot make me feel degraded in my own eyes. Shall I create another one like you, so that you can join hands and ruin the world with your tyranny? Get out of my sight! You heard my answer; even if you torture me, I will not consent."
es_translation: —Well yes, I refuse —I replied—, and no torture will make me agree. You may turn me into the most miserable of men, but you will not make me despise myself. Do you think I could create another being like you, so that by joining forces you could ravage the world? Get away! I have answered you; you may torture me, but I will never consent!

en: “You swear,” I said, “to be harmless; but have you not already shown a degree of malice that should reasonably make me distrust you? May not even this be a feint that will increase your triumph by affording a wider scope for your revenge?”
vi: “Mi thề,” tôi nói, “sẽ không làm hại ai; nhưng chẳng lẽ mi đã không tỏ cái thiên hướng xấu xa tới một mức độ đủ để khiến ta mất tin tưởng? Biết đâu đó chỉ là ngón giả vờ để thổi phồng sự đắc thắng của mi bằng cách tìm được một phạm vi trả thù càng thêm rộng lớn.
tr: Ona yakınlık duymuyorum diye, ancak benden gelebilecek bir mutluluğu esirgemeye hakkım olmadığını düşündüm, "Kimseye zarar vermeyeceğine yemin ediyorsun,” dedim, "ama şimdiye kadar güvenimi yeterince sarsacak hainlikler sergilemedin mi? Bu da zaferini daha büyük bir intikamla taçlandırmak adına düşünülmüş bir aldatmaca olamaz mı?
es: —Juras —le dije— que no causarás más daños; ¿no has demostrado ya un grado de maldad que debiera, con razón, hacerme desconfiar de ti? ¿No será esto una trampa que aumentará tu triunfo, al otorgarte mayores posibilidades de venganza?
vi_translation: “You swear,” I said, “not to harm anyone; but haven't you already shown such a wicked tendency to a degree that makes me lose trust? Who knows if this is just a pretense to inflate your triumph by finding an even broader scope for revenge.”
tr_translation: I thought that just because I didn't feel close to him, I had no right to withhold a happiness that could only come from me, "You swear you won't harm anyone," I said, "but haven't you already committed enough treacheries to shake my trust? Could this not be a deception devised to crown your victory with an even greater revenge?"
es_translation: —Juras —I said to him— that you will not cause more harm; haven't you already demonstrated a degree of malice that should, rightfully, make me distrust you? Could this not be a trap that will increase your triumph by granting you greater opportunities for revenge?

en: “I consent to your demand, on your solemn oath to quit Europe for ever, and every other place in the neighbourhood of man, as soon as I shall deliver into your hands a female who will accompany you in your exile.”
vi: “Ta chấp nhận đòi hỏi của mi, mi hãy thề sẽ vĩnh viễn rời khỏi châu Âu, xa tất cả những nơi có người ở, ngay khi ta trao cho mi một sinh vật nữ để đồng hành với mi tới chốn lưu đày.”
tr: Böylece ona döndüm ve, "Sürgündeki hayatında sana eşlik edecek dişiyi yanına verdiğim anda Avrupa'dan ve insanın yaşadığı tüm yerlerden sonsuza kadar uzaklaşacağına ant içtiğin takdirde, isteğini kabul ediyorum," dedim.
es: —Accedo a la petición, bajo la solemne promesa de que abandonarás para siempre Europa, y de que evitarás cualquier otro lugar que el hombre frecuente, en cuanto te entregue la compañera que habrá de seguirte al exilio.
vi_translation: “I accept your demand; you must swear to forever leave Europe, far from all inhabited places, as soon as I provide you with a female creature to accompany you into exile.”
tr_translation: So I turned to him and said, "I accept your request on the condition that you swear to forever leave Europe and all places inhabited by humans the moment I provide you with a female companion to accompany you in your life of exile."
es_translation: —I accede to the request, under the solemn promise that you will forever abandon Europe, and that you will avoid any other place frequented by man, as soon as I deliver to you the companion who will follow you into exile.

en: Saying this, he suddenly quitted me, fearful, perhaps, of any change in my sentiments. I saw him descend the mountain with greater speed than the flight of an eagle, and quickly lost among the undulations of the sea of ice.
vi: Nói xong hắn đột ngột bỏ đi, có lẽ sợ tôi thình lình đổi ý. Tôi nhìn hắn xuống núi, lao nhanh hơn đại bàng bay, rồi mất hút sau mặt biển băng nhấp nhô.
tr: Bu sözleri söylediği gibi, belki de fikrimi değiştirebileceğim korkusuyla yanımdan ayrıldı. Dağdan aşağı bir kartaldan hızlı inişini ve buz denizinin kıvrımları arasında gözden kayboluşunu izledim.
es: No bien hubo terminado de hablar cuando me abandonó, temeroso quizá de que cambiara de nuevo mi decisión. Lo vi bajar por la montaña más rápido que el vuelo de un águila, y pronto lo perdí de vista entre las ondulaciones del mar de hielo.
vi_translation: After speaking, he abruptly left, perhaps fearing I might suddenly change my mind. I watched him descend the mountain, moving faster than an eagle in flight, then disappearing behind the undulating ice sea.
tr_translation: As soon as he said these words, he left my side, perhaps fearing that I might change my mind. I watched his descent down the mountain faster than an eagle and his disappearance among the curves of the icy sea.
es_translation: No sooner had he finished speaking than he left me, perhaps fearful that I might change my decision again. I saw him descend the mountain faster than the flight of an eagle, and soon I lost sight of him among the undulations of the sea of ice.

en: On the whole island there were but three miserable huts, and one of these was vacant when I arrived. This I hired. It contained but two rooms, and these exhibited all the squalidness of the most miserable penury. The thatch had fallen in, the walls were unplastered, and the door was off its hinges. I ordered it to be repaired, bought some furniture, and took possession, an incident which would doubtless have occasioned some surprise had not all the senses of the cottagers been benumbed by want and squalid poverty. As it was, I lived ungazed at and unmolested, hardly thanked for the pittance of food and clothes which I gave, so much does suffering blunt even the coarsest sensations of men.
vi: Trên toàn hòn đảo chỉ có ba căn lều rách, trong đó có một căn bỏ trống khi tôi đến. Tôi thuê căn này. Nó chỉ có hai phòng, mang đủ vẻ nhếch nhác của cảnh nghèo khó cùng cực. Vôi vữa trên tường đã lở, rơm phủ mái nhà đã rơi rụng tả tơi, cửa giả thì long cả bản lề. Tôi cho sửa chữa lại nhà, mua vài thứ đồ đạc rồi dọn đến ở hẳn; một sự kiện hẳn đã gây ngạc nhiên lớn cho dân đảo, nếu không phải họ đã đói kém và quẫn bách đến mụ cả người lên rồi. Thế là tôi sống chẳng bị ai dòm ngó và quấy rầy, chẳng mấy khi được cảm ơn vì chỗ thức ăn, quần áo ít ỏi tôi đem cho họ - đau khổ làm cùn cả những cảm xúc thô sơ nhất ở con người như vậy đấy.
tr: Adada topu topu üç adet köhne kulübe vardı ve ben geldiğimde içlerinden biri boştu. Onu da ben kiraladım. Kulübe iki odalıydı ve odalar yoksulluğun tüm sefilliğini yansıtıyordu. Dam çökmüştü, duvarlar sıvasızdı, kapı ise menteşelerinden ayrılmıştı. Evin onarılması için sipariş verdim, birkaç parça mobilya getirttim ve ardından evi satın aldım. Ada sakinlerinin duyuları yoksulluk ve sefillikten körelmemiş olsaydı tüm bunlar şüphesiz şaşkınlık yaratırdı. Böylece gözetlenmeden, rahatsız edilmeden yaşadım ve ada sakinleri verdiğim bir miktar yiyecek ve giysiye karşılık bir teşekkür bile etmediler. İşte ıstırap insanın en temel duyarlılıklarını bile böylesine köreltiyordu.
es: En toda la isla no había más que tres míseras chozas, una de las cuales encontré desocupada al llegar. La alquilé. Tenía sólo dos cuartos, que mostraban la suciedad propia de las más absoluta indigencia. La techumbre, de ramas y rastrojos, se estaba hundiendo; las paredes no estaban encaladas, y la puerta colgaba, torcida, de uno de los goznes. Ordené que la repararan, compré algunos muebles y me instalé, lo que sin duda hubiera ocasionado bastante sorpresa de no ser porque la necesidad y la pobreza habían entumecido por completo las mentes de estos habitantes. El hecho es que ni me molestaban ni curioseaban, y apenas si me agradecieron los víveres y ropas que les di, lo que demuestra hasta qué punto el sufrimiento insensibiliza incluso los sentimientos más elementales del hombre.
vi_translation: On the entire island, there were only three shabby huts, one of which was vacant when I arrived. I rented this one. It had only two rooms, bearing the full appearance of extreme poverty. The plaster on the walls had crumbled, the straw covering the roof was tattered and falling apart, and the doors were hanging off their hinges. I had the house repaired, bought some furniture, and moved in permanently; an event that surely would have surprised the islanders, had they not been so starved and desperate that they were numb to everything. Thus, I lived without anyone watching or disturbing me, rarely receiving thanks for the little food and clothing I gave them - suffering had dulled even the most basic human emotions in them.
tr_translation: There were only three dilapidated huts in the town, and when I arrived, one of them was empty. I rented that one. The hut had two rooms, and the rooms reflected all the misery of poverty. The roof had collapsed, the walls were unplastered, and the door had come off its hinges. I ordered repairs for the house, brought in a few pieces of furniture, and then bought the house. If the islanders' senses had not been dulled by poverty and misery, all of this would undoubtedly have caused astonishment. Thus, I lived without being watched or disturbed, and the islanders did not even thank me for the food and clothes I gave them. Such is the way that suffering dulls even the most basic sensitivities of a person.
es_translation: On the entire island, there were only three miserable huts, one of which I found unoccupied upon my arrival. I rented it. It had only two rooms, which displayed the filth typical of the most absolute destitution. The roof, made of branches and straw, was caving in; the walls were not whitewashed, and the door hung, crooked, from one of its hinges. I ordered it to be repaired, bought some furniture, and settled in, which undoubtedly would have caused quite a bit of surprise if it weren't for the fact that necessity and poverty had completely numbed the minds of these inhabitants. The fact is that they neither bothered nor were curious about me, and they barely thanked me for the food and clothes I gave them, which demonstrates to what extent suffering desensitizes even the most basic human feelings.

en: Even if they were to leave Europe and inhabit the deserts of the new world, yet one of the first results of those sympathies for which the dæmon thirsted would be children, and a race of devils would be propagated upon the earth who might make the very existence of the species of man a condition precarious and full of terror. Had I right, for my own benefit, to inflict this curse upon everlasting generations? I had before been moved by the sophisms of the being I had created; I had been struck senseless by his fiendish threats; but now, for the first time, the wickedness of my promise burst upon me; I shuddered to think that future ages might curse me as their pest, whose selfishness had not hesitated to buy its own peace at the price, perhaps, of the existence of the whole human race.
vi: Ngay cả nếu như chúng cùng nhau rời khỏi châu Âu, tới vùng hoang địa của thế giới mới, thì kết quả đầu tiên của tình đồng cảm mà tên ác thần khao khát đến thế sẽ là việc chúng sinh con đẻ cái, và một nòi giống quỷ sẽ lan tràn khắp thế gian, khiến cho cả sự tồn tại của loài người sẽ bị đặt vào một tình thế nguy hiểm và đầy khiếp sợ. Liệu tôi có quyền, vì lợi ích riêng tư, đem lời nguyền đó trút lên các thế hệ mãi mãi về sau không? Tôi đã từng cảm động vì lời lẽ ngụy biện của kẻ do tôi tạo ra; tôi đã bị những lời hăm dọa ma quỷ của hắn làm khiếp sợ đến mất lý trí; nhưng giờ đây, lần đầu tiên tôi nhận ra tai họa trong lời hứa của mình; tôi rùng mình nghĩ đến các thế hệ tương lai sẽ nguyền rủa tôi gieo vạ cho chúng, chỉ vì ích kỷ đã không ngần ngại mua lấy yên bình cho bản thân với cái giá là - biết đâu đấy - sự tồn vong của toàn thể giống người.
tr: İkisi Avrupa'dan ayrılsalar ve Yeni Dünya'nın çöllerini mesken tutsalar dahi, iblisin uğruna yanıp tutuştuğu arzuların en başında çocuk sahibi olmak gelecek ve şeytanın soyu yeryüzünde türeyecekti. Böylece insan türünün varlığı istikrarsızlaştıracak, tehlikeye girecekti. Kendi çıkarım adına geleceğin nesillerini böylesi bir lanete maruz bırakmaya hakkım var mıydı? İşin aslı, yarattığım varlığın safsatalarına kanmış, şeytani tehditleri karşısında tutulup kalmıştım. Vaadimin korkunçluğunun ilk kez farkına varıyordum. Gelecek nesillerin beni bir parça huzur uğruna belki de tüm insan ırkının varlığını sona erdirmeyi göze almış, bencil bir musibet gibi lanetleyeceklerini düşününce içim titredi.
es: Y aunque abandonaran Europa, y habitaran en los desiertos del Nuevo Mundo, una de las primeras consecuencias de ese amor que tanto ansiaba el vil ser serían los hijos. Se propagaría entonces por la Tierra una raza de demonios que podrían sumir a la especie humana en el terror y hacer de su misma existencia algo precario. ¿Tenía yo derecho, en aras de mi propio interés, a dotar con esta maldición a las generaciones futuras? Me habían conmovido los sofismas del ser que había creado; sus malévolas amenazas me habían nublado los sentidos. Pero ahora por primera vez veía claramente lo devastadora que podía llegar a ser mi promesa; temblaba al pensar que generaciones futuras me podrían maldecir como el causante de esa plaga, como el ser cuyo egoísmo no había tenido reparos en comprar su propia paz al precio quizá de la existencia de todo el género humano.
vi_translation: Even if they were to leave Europe together, to the wilderness of the new world, the first result of the sympathy that the fiend so eagerly desired would be their procreation, and a race of devils would spread across the world, putting the very existence of mankind in a perilous and terrifying situation. Do I have the right, for my own private benefit, to cast that curse upon future generations forever? I had once been moved by the sophistry of the being I created; I had been terrified to the point of losing my sanity by his demonic threats; but now, for the first time, I realized the calamity in my promise; I shuddered to think of future generations cursing me for bringing disaster upon them, simply because my selfishness did not hesitate to buy peace for myself at the cost of - who knows - the survival of the entire human race.
tr_translation: Even if the two were to leave Europe and settle in the deserts of the New World, the foremost desire burning within the devil would be to have children, and the devil's lineage would proliferate on Earth. Thus, the existence of the human species would become destabilized and endangered. Did I have the right to subject future generations to such a curse for my own benefit? The truth is, I had been deceived by the sophistries of the being I had created, and I was paralyzed by its demonic threats. For the first time, I realized the horror of my promise. My heart trembled at the thought that future generations might curse me as a selfish calamity who had risked the existence of the entire human race for a bit of personal peace.
es_translation: And even if they abandoned Europe and inhabited the deserts of the New World, one of the first consequences of that love so eagerly desired by the vile being would be children. Then a race of demons would spread across the Earth, capable of plunging the human species into terror and making their very existence precarious. Did I have the right, for the sake of my own interest, to endow future generations with this curse? I had been moved by the sophisms of the being I had created; his malevolent threats had clouded my senses. But now for the first time, I clearly saw how devastating my promise could be; I trembled at the thought that future generations might curse me as the cause of that plague, as the being whose selfishness had not hesitated to buy his own peace at the possible cost of the existence of the entire human race.

en: Presently I heard the sound of footsteps along the passage; the door opened, and the wretch whom I dreaded appeared. Shutting the door, he approached me and said in a smothered voice,
vi: Tiếp đến tôi nghe tiếng bước chân vang dọc lối đi; cửa phòng tôi mở ra, của khốn nạn tôi đang khiếp hãi xuất hiện. Hắn đóng cửa lại, đến gần tôi, nói bằng một giọng đã nén dịu:
tr: Dışarıdan gelen ayak seslerini duyabiliyordum. Nihayet kapı açıldı ve tüylerimi diken diken eden o ucube göründü. Kapıyı kapadıktan sonra yanıma gelerek güçlükle kontrol ettiği sesiyle konuştu, “Başladığın işi bozdun, amacın nedir?
es: Al poco oí pisadas por el pasillo; se abrió la puerta y apareció el temido engendro. La cerró, y, acercándoseme, me dijo con voz sorda:
vi_translation: Next, I heard footsteps echoing along the corridor; my door opened, and the wretched person I was dreading appeared. He closed the door, approached me, and spoke in a subdued tone:
tr_translation: I could hear the footsteps coming from outside. Finally, the door opened and that freak, which made my hair stand on end, appeared. After closing the door, he came to me and spoke with a voice he could barely control, "You ruined the work you started, what is your purpose?
es_translation: Soon I heard footsteps in the hallway; the door opened and the feared creature appeared. He closed it, and, approaching me, he said in a muffled voice:

en: The monster saw my determination in my face and gnashed his teeth in the impotence of anger. “Shall each man,” cried he, “find a wife for his bosom, and each beast have his mate, and I be alone? I had feelings of affection, and they were requited by detestation and scorn. Man! You may hate, but beware! Your hours will pass in dread and misery, and soon the bolt will fall which must ravish from you your happiness for ever. Are you to be happy while I grovel in the intensity of my wretchedness? You can blast my other passions, but revenge remains—revenge, henceforth dearer than light or food! I may die, but first you, my tyrant and tormentor, shall curse the sun that gazes on your misery. Beware, for I am fearless and therefore powerful. I will watch with the wiliness of a snake, that I may sting with its venom. Man, you shall repent of the injuries you inflict.”
vi: Con quái vật nhìn thấy vẻ quyết tâm trên nét mặt tôi, nghiến răng nghiến lợi trong cơn điên giận bất lực. “Chẳng lẽ mỗi con người đều có quyền ấp ủ một bạn đời,” hắn thét lên, “và cả đến con vật cũng có đôi có lứa, mà chỉ mình ta đơn chiếc hay sao? Ta đã từng có tình cảm yêu thương nhưng nó được đền đáp bởi ghét bỏ và căm giận. Con người kia! Cứ ghét đi, nhưng hãy coi chừng! Ngày giờ còn lại của ngươi sẽ trôi qua trong khiếp đảm và khổ sở, tiếng sét sẽ nhanh chóng giáng xuống, cướp đi vĩnh viễn của ngươi mọi hạnh phúc. Chẳng lẽ ngươi có quyền hạnh phúc khi ta phải đắm mình trong cảnh khốn nạn tận cùng ư? Ngươi có thể tiêu diệt mọi tình cảm khác của ta, nhưng sự thù hằn còn mãi đó - thù hằn từ đây quý báu hơn cả ánh sáng, cả thức ăn! Ta có thể chết, nhưng ngươi, tên bạo chúa, kẻ hành hạ ta, trước hết sẽ nguyền rủa mặt trời đã chiếu sáng trên nỗi khổ của ngươi. Hãy coi chừng; ta không sợ gì hết, do đó ta mạnh mẽ. Ta sẽ canh chừng ngươi xảo quyệt như rắn, để chờ táp được ngươi bằng nọc rắn. Hỡi con người, ngươi sẽ phải ân hận vì những tổn thất đã gây ra.”
tr: Kararlılığımı gören canavar öfkeyle dişlerini gıcırdatarak konuştu, "Her insan gönlüne göre bir eş bulsun, her yaratığın bir dengi olsun da, bir tek ben mi yalnız kalayım? İçim sevgiyle doluydu, ama karşılığında yalnız horgörü ve aşağılama buldum. Ey, insan evladı! Benden nefret edebilirsin ama kendini kolla! Bundan sonraki günlerin korku ve keder içinde geçecek ve yakında üstüne inecek darbe, mutluluğunu sonsuza kadar elinden koparıp alacak. Ben sefalet içinde sürünürken, mutlu olacağını mı sandın yoksa? Diğer arzularımı ayaklarının altına alabilirsin ama bundan böyle bana gün ışığından, yiyip içtiğimden daha kıymetli olacak intikamımı asla! Ben ölecek olsam da önce bana zulüm ve işkence eden sen, felaketini seyredecek gün ışığına lanetler yağdıracaksın. Unutma ki ben korkusuzum ve bu nedenle de güçlüyüm. Bir yılanın sinsiliğiyle gözleyeceğim seni, tıpkı onun gibi zehrimi akıtabileyim diye. Çektirdiğin acılara çok pişman olacaksın.
es: El monstruo vio la determinación en mi rostro y rechinó los dientes con rabia imponente. —¿Encontrará todo hombre —gritó— esposa, todo animal su hembra mientras yo he de permanecer solo? Tenía sentimientos de afecto, que el desprecio y el odio anularon en mí. Mortal, podrás odiar, pero ¡ten cuidado! Pasarás tus horas preso de terror y tristeza, y pronto caerá sobre ti el golpe que te ha de robar para siempre la felicidad. ¿Acaso piensas que puedes ser feliz mientras yo me arrastro bajo el peso de mi desdicha? Podrás destrozar mis otras pasiones; pero queda mi venganza, una venganza que a partir de ahora me será más querida que la luz o los alimentos. Podré morir, pero antes, tú, mi tirano y verdugo, maldecirás el sol que alumbra tus desgracias. Ten cuidado; pues no conozco el miedo y soy, por tanto, poderoso. Vigilaré con la astucia de la serpiente, y con su veneno te morderé. ¡Mortal!, te arrepentirás del daño que me has hecho.
vi_translation: The monster saw the determination on my face, gritting its teeth in helpless rage. “Does every human have the right to cherish a mate,” it screamed, “and even animals have pairs, but I alone am solitary? I once had loving feelings, but they were met with hatred and anger. Human! Hate me all you want, but beware! Your remaining days will pass in terror and misery, the thunderbolt will soon strike, forever taking away all your happiness. Do you have the right to happiness while I must drown in utter wretchedness? You may destroy all my other feelings, but hatred remains - hatred now more precious than light, than food! I may die, but you, tyrant, tormentor, will first curse the sun that shone upon your suffering. Beware; I fear nothing, therefore I am strong. I will watch you as cunningly as a snake, waiting to strike you with venom. Human, you will regret the harm you have caused.”
tr_translation: Seeing my determination, the monster spoke through gritted teeth in anger, "Let every human find a mate to their heart's desire, let every creature have a counterpart, and am I to remain alone? My heart was filled with love, but in return, I found only contempt and scorn. Oh, child of man! You may hate me, but beware! The days ahead will be filled with fear and sorrow, and the blow that will soon fall upon you will rip away your happiness forever. Did you think you would be happy while I languish in misery? You may trample on my other desires, but never my revenge, which from now on will be more precious to me than daylight, food, or drink! Even if I am to die, you who have inflicted cruelty and torture upon me will curse the daylight on the day you witness your own disaster. Remember that I am fearless, and because of this, I am strong. I will watch you with the cunning of a snake, so that I can release my venom just like it. You will deeply regret the pain you have caused.”
es_translation: The monster saw the determination on my face and gnashed its teeth with imposing rage. —Will every man —he shouted— find a wife, every animal its mate while I must remain alone? I had feelings of affection, which contempt and hatred have annulled in me. Mortal, you may hate, but beware! You will spend your hours imprisoned by terror and sadness, and soon the blow that will forever rob you of happiness will fall upon you. Do you think you can be happy while I crawl under the weight of my misery? You may destroy my other passions; but my revenge remains, a revenge that from now on will be dearer to me than light or food. I may die, but before that, you, my tyrant and executioner, will curse the sun that illuminates your misfortunes. Beware; for I know no fear and am therefore powerful. I will watch with the cunning of the serpent, and with its venom I will bite you. Mortal! You will regret the harm you have done to me.

en: “Devil, cease; and do not poison the air with these sounds of malice. I have declared my resolution to you, and I am no coward to bend beneath words. Leave me; I am inexorable.”
vi: “Ác quỷ, hãy im đi; đừng làm bẩn không khí bởi những lời tàn độc đó nữa. Ta đã công bố quyết định của ta rồi, và ta không hèn nhát tới mức uốn lưỡi đổi lời đâu. Đi đi, ý ta không thể lay chuyển được.”
tr: “Defol git buradan iblis! Çirkin sözlerinle zehirleme havayı. Kararımı açıkladım sana, sözlerine boyun eğecek kadar yüreksiz de değilim. Rahat bırak beni, dönmem artık hükmümden.
es: —Calla, diablo, y no envenenes el aire con tus malvados ruidos. Te he comunicado mi decisión, y no soy un cobarde al que puedas convencer con tus amenazas. Déjame; soy implacable.
vi_translation: “Demon, be silent; do not pollute the air with those cruel words anymore. I have already announced my decision, and I am not cowardly enough to twist my words. Go, my resolve cannot be shaken.”
tr_translation: "Get out of here, demon! Don't poison the air with your ugly words. I've made my decision clear to you, and I'm not cowardly enough to yield to your words. Leave me alone, I won't go back on my judgment."
es_translation: —Shut up, devil, and do not poison the air with your wicked noises. I have communicated my decision to you, and I am not a coward whom you can convince with your threats. Leave me; I am relentless.

en: Some hours passed thus; but by degrees, as the sun declined towards the horizon, the wind died away into a gentle breeze and the sea became free from breakers. But these gave place to a heavy swell; I felt sick and hardly able to hold the rudder, when suddenly I saw a line of high land towards the south.
vi: Vài giờ đồng hồ trôi qua như vậy; nhưng rồi dần dần, khi mặt trời từ từ hạ xuống đường chân trời, gió cũng dịu đi thành làn nhè nhẹ, và không còn sóng táp nữa. Nhưng thay vào đó lòng biển lại động dữ dội; tôi nôn nao cả người, và không cầm nổi mái chèo, thì bỗng trông thấy về phía Nam có một dải đất cao.
tr: Bu şekilde birkaç saat geçti. Güneş ufukta alçaldıkça rüzgâr yavaş yavaş tatlı bir esintiye dönüştü ve deniz dalgalardan arındı. Ancak hemen ardından sular iyice kabardı. Midem bulanmıştı ve dümene güçlükle hâkim oluyordum ki güney yönünde yükselen karayı gördüm.
es: Así transcurrieron algunas horas, pero poco a poco, a medida que el sol caminaba hacia el horizonte, el viento fue remitiendo hasta convertirse en una suave brisa, y las olas se fueron calmando. Seguía habiendo una fuerte marejada, me encontraba mal, y apenas podía sujetar el timón, cuando de pronto divisé hacia el sur una franja de tierras altas.
vi_translation: A few hours passed like that; but then gradually, as the sun slowly descended to the horizon, the wind also calmed down to a gentle breeze, and there were no more crashing waves. But instead, the sea became violently agitated; I felt nauseous and couldn't hold the oar, when suddenly I saw a high strip of land to the south.
tr_translation: A few hours passed this way. As the sun lowered on the horizon, the wind gradually turned into a gentle breeze and the sea cleared of waves. But immediately afterward, the waters swelled significantly. My stomach was queasy and I was struggling to control the helm when I saw the land rising to the south.
es_translation: Thus, a few hours passed, but little by little, as the sun moved towards the horizon, the wind began to subside until it became a gentle breeze, and the waves started to calm down. There was still a strong swell, I felt unwell, and I could barely hold the helm, when suddenly I spotted a strip of highlands to the south.

en: I turned with loathing from the woman who could utter so unfeeling a speech to a person just saved, on the very edge of death; but I felt languid and unable to reflect on all that had passed. The whole series of my life appeared to me as a dream; I sometimes doubted if indeed it were all true, for it never presented itself to my mind with the force of reality.
vi: Tôi ghê tởm quay đi khỏi mụ đàn bà đã thốt ra những lời lẽ vô tình đến thế đối với một người vừa mới được cứu sống bên bờ vực của cái chết; tuy nhiên tôi cảm thấy mình quá yếu, không nghĩ nổi về những gì đã qua. Toàn bộ đời tôi diễn ra như một giấc mơ; tôi còn tự hỏi liệu nó có đúng là có thực, bởi nó không bao giờ xuất hiện trước mắt tôi với toàn bộ sức nặng thực tế.
tr: Herkes öyle yapsa iyi olurdu doğrusu." ölümün kıyısından dönmüş birine böylesi duygusuz sözler söyleyebilen kadından tiksintiyle çevirdim yüzümü. Ancak kendimi hayli bitkin hissediyor, olup bitenleri kafamda toparlayamıyordum. Hayatım bana baştan sonra bir rüya gibi görünüyordu. Kimi zaman gerçekliğinden dahi şüphe ediyordum, çünkü zihnimde gerçek izlenimi uyandırmıyordu.
es: Asqueado, volví el rostro ante las palabras de la mujer, que podía hablar tan inhumanamente a alguien que acaba de escapar de la muerte. Pero estaba muy débil y no podía reflexionar bien sobre todo lo que había sucedido. Mi vida entera se me aparecía como una pesadilla; me preguntaba si todo aquello era cierto, pues los hechos nunca conseguían imponérseme con la fuerza de la realidad.
vi_translation: I turned away in disgust from the woman who had uttered such heartless words towards someone who had just been saved from the brink of death; however, I felt too weak to think about what had happened. My entire life seemed like a dream; I even wondered if it was real, as it never appeared before me with the full weight of reality.
tr_translation: I turned my face away in disgust from the woman who could say such heartless words to someone who had just escaped death. However, I felt quite exhausted and couldn't piece together what had happened in my mind. My life seemed like a dream from beginning to end. Sometimes I even doubted its reality, because it didn't evoke a sense of reality in my mind.
es_translation: Disgusted, I turned my face away at the woman's words, who could speak so inhumanly to someone who had just escaped death. But I was very weak and couldn't reflect well on everything that had happened. My entire life appeared to me like a nightmare; I wondered if all that was true, as the events never managed to impose themselves on me with the force of reality.

en: “I know that the sympathy of a stranger can be but of little relief to one borne down as you are by so strange a misfortune. But you will, I hope, soon quit this melancholy abode, for doubtless evidence can easily be brought to free you from the criminal charge.”
vi: “Tôi biết sự thông cảm của một người lạ như tôi khó làm anh nhẹ bớt được gánh nặng của nỗi bất hạnh lạ lùng đến nhường ấy. Nhưng tôi hy vọng anh sắp được ra khỏi chỗ buồn thảm này rồi; bởi dĩ nhiên, có những chứng cớ rành rành gỡ anh thoát khỏi lời buộc tội.”
tr: “Sizin gibi tuhaf talihsizliklerle boğuşmuş biri için, bir yabancının gösterdiği ilginin fazla kıymeti yoktur bilirim. Ancak yakında kederinizden sıyrılacağınızı umuyorum, çünkü hakkınızdaki suçlamalardan kurtulmanızı sağlayacak kanıtlar kolayca elimize geçecektir,” dedi.
es: —Sé que la comprensión de un extraño poco puede ayudar a alguien hundido por tan insólita desgracia. Pero confío en que pronto podrá abandonar este lóbrego lugar, pues indudablemente se podrán aportar pruebas que le eximan de culpa.
vi_translation: “I know that the sympathy of a stranger like me can hardly lighten the burden of such a strange misfortune for you. But I hope you will soon be able to leave this sorrowful place; for there is, of course, clear evidence that will free you from the accusation.”
tr_translation: “I know that for someone who has struggled with strange misfortunes like you, the interest shown by a stranger is not of much value. However, I hope that you will soon recover from your sorrow, because evidence that will clear you of the accusations against you will easily come into our hands,” he said.
es_translation: —I know that the understanding of a stranger can do little to help someone overwhelmed by such an unusual misfortune. But I trust that you will soon be able to leave this gloomy place, as undoubtedly evidence can be provided that will exonerate you from blame.

en: “Nothing indeed could be more unfortunate and agonising than the strange chances that have lately occurred. You were thrown, by some surprising accident, on this shore, renowned for its hospitality, seized immediately, and charged with murder. The first sight that was presented to your eyes was the body of your friend, murdered in so unaccountable a manner and placed, as it were, by some fiend across your path.”
vi: “Quả thật những ngẫu nhiên lạ lùng xảy ra vừa rồi đúng là quá đau đớn và bất hạnh cho anh. Bởi một sự tình cờ đáng ngạc nhiên nào đó, anh bị ném lên bờ biển này, một nơi có tiếng là hiếu khách; bị tóm cổ lập tức, và bị buộc tội sát nhân. Cái mà anh nhìn thấy đầu tiên là thi thể người bạn thân nhất của anh, bị giết một cách không giải thích nổi đến vậy, như thể có một con quỷ nào đó đem đặt giữa đường anh.”
tr: “Son zamanlarda yaşanan tuhaf tesadüflerden daha talihsiz ve acı bir şey olamaz hakikaten. Beklenmedik bir kaza sonucu misafirperverliğiyle ünlü bu kıyıya sürüklendiniz, karaya adımınızı atar atmaz ise tutuklanarak cinayetle itham edildiniz. Karşınıza çıkan ilk manzaraysa caninin biri tarafından akıl almaz bir şekilde öldürüldükten sonra yolunuzun üstüne bırakılan dostunuzun cesedi oldu.
es: —En efecto, pocas cosas habrá más desafortunadas y penosas que las extrañas coincidencias que han ocurrido recientemente. De forma accidental vino a parar a esta costa, famosa por su hospitalidad; fue detenido inmediatamente y culpado de asesinato. La primera cosa que le obligamos a ver fue el cadáver de su amigo, asesinado de forma inexplicable, y puesto en su camino por algún criminal.
vi_translation: “Indeed, the strange coincidences that have just occurred are truly too painful and unfortunate for you. By some astonishing chance, you were thrown onto this shore, a place known for its hospitality; immediately seized, and accused of murder. The first thing you saw was the body of your best friend, inexplicably killed, as if some demon had placed it in your path.”
tr_translation: “There truly can be nothing more unfortunate and painful than the strange coincidences that have occurred recently. You were dragged to this shore, famous for its hospitality, due to an unexpected accident, and as soon as you set foot on land, you were arrested and accused of murder. The first sight you encountered was the body of your friend, left in your path after being killed in an unimaginable way by a murderer.”
es_translation: —Indeed, there are few things more unfortunate and distressing than the strange coincidences that have occurred recently. By accident, he ended up on this coast, famous for its hospitality; he was immediately detained and accused of murder. The first thing we forced him to see was the corpse of his friend, inexplicably murdered, and placed in his path by some criminal.

en: Ever since my recovery from the fever, I had been in the custom of taking every night a small quantity of laudanum, for it was by means of this drug only that I was enabled to gain the rest necessary for the preservation of life. Oppressed by the recollection of my various misfortunes, I now swallowed double my usual quantity and soon slept profoundly. But sleep did not afford me respite from thought and misery; my dreams presented a thousand objects that scared me. Towards morning I was possessed by a kind of nightmare; I felt the fiend’s grasp in my neck and could not free myself from it; groans and cries rang in my ears. My father, who was watching over me, perceiving my restlessness, awoke me; the dashing waves were around, the cloudy sky above, the fiend was not here: a sense of security, a feeling that a truce was established between the present hour and the irresistible, disastrous future imparted to me a kind of calm forgetfulness, of which the human mind is by its structure peculiarly susceptible.
vi: Kể từ khi qua khỏi cơn sốt sảng, tôi có thói quen hàng đêm uống một lượng nhỏ cồn thuốc phiện; bởi chỉ có thứ độc dược này mới giúp tôi có được giấc ngủ cần thiết để bảo tồn sự sống của mình. Lúc này quá căng thẳng vì nhớ lại những bất hạnh chồng chất, tôi uống một liều gấp đôi thường lệ, và mau chóng chìm vào giấc ngủ say. Tuy nhiên giấc ngủ cũng chẳng giúp nổi tôi lìa được suy tưởng và khổ đau; cơn mơ đưa tới hàng ngàn thứ khiến tôi hãi hùng. Tới gần sáng tôi bị ám ảnh bởi một cơn ác mộng; tôi cảm thấy con quỷ đã nắm được cổ tôi, tôi không sao thoát ra được, trong tai ong ong những tiếng rên rỉ và kêu thét. Cha tôi, vốn vẫn canh chừng, thấy tôi trăn trở vùng vẫy, liền đánh thức tôi dậy; chung quanh tôi dạt dào sóng vỗ, trên đầu là bầu trời đầy mây, con quỷ không thấy đâu: một cảm giác an toàn, cảm tưởng về một sự ngưng chiến dựng lên chắn giữa giờ phút hiện tại với tương lai thảm khốc không tránh khỏi bỗng đem tới cho tôi sự quên lãng yên bình, mà do cấu tạo của mình tâm trí con người rất dễ dàng tiếp nhận.
tr: Hummalı dönemimi geride bıraktığımdan beri her gece küçük bir miktar afyon tentürü almayı alışkanlık edinmiştim, çünkü ancak bu ilaç sayesinde gevşeyip yaşamımı sürdürebilmem için gereken uykuya kavuşabiliyordum. Talihsizliklerimin anısının yarattığı bu baskı altında dozu her zamankinin iki katma çıkardım ve derin bir uykuya daldım. Ancak uyku beni düşünceden, kederden uzaklaştırmadı. Düşlerim içime korku salan binlerce şeyle doluydu. Sabaha doğru korkunç bir kâbusla sarsıldım. İblisin ellerini boğazımda hissediyor, kendimi bir türlü kurtaramıyordum. İnlemeler, çığlıklar kulaklarımda çınlıyordu. Gözünü üstümden eksik etmeyen babam huzursuzlandığımı fark edince beni uyandırdı. Etrafta deli dalgalar, gökte bulutlar vardı, iblis ise görünürlerde yoktu. Bir nevi güvenlik hissiydi bu; şimdi ile kaçınılmaz olan arasındaki bir ateşkes, felakederle dolu geleceğimin bana bahşettiği ve insan aklının yapısı itibarıyla meylettiği türden huzur dolu bir unutkanlıktı.
es: Desde que me había repuesto de la fiebre me había acostumbrado a tomar cada noche una pequeña cantidad de láudano, pues sólo con la ayuda de esta droga conseguía obtener el descanso necesario para mantenerme con vida. Torturado por el recuerdo de mis múltiples desgracias, tomé una doble dosis y pronto me dormí profundamente. Pero el sueño no me liberó de mis pensamientos ni de mi desgracia, y soñé con mil cosas que me atemorizaban.
