Cerca del amanecer tuve una horrible pesadilla: sentí cómo el malvado ser me oprimía la garganta; yo no me podía librar de su zarpa, y lamentos y alaridos resonaban en mi cabeza. Mi padre, que velaba mi sueño, advirtió mi inquietud y, despertándome, me señaló el puerto de Holyhead, en el cual estábamos entrando.
vi_translation: Since recovering from the delirious fever, I have had the habit of drinking a small amount of opium tincture every night; for only this poison helps me achieve the necessary sleep to preserve my life. At this moment, too stressed from recalling the piled-up misfortunes, I drank a double dose of my usual amount and quickly fell into a deep sleep. However, sleep did not help me escape from thoughts and suffering; the dream brought forth thousands of things that terrified me. Near dawn, I was haunted by a nightmare; I felt the demon had grabbed my neck, I couldn't break free, my ears buzzing with moans and screams. My father, who was still keeping watch, saw me tossing and turning, struggling, and woke me up; around me, the waves were lapping, above was a cloudy sky, the demon was nowhere to be seen: a sense of safety, the impression of a truce standing between the present moment and the inevitable dreadful future suddenly brought me a peaceful oblivion, which the human mind, by its nature, readily accepts.
tr_translation: Since I left my feverish period behind, I had made it a habit to take a small amount of opium tincture every night, because only with this medicine could I relax and achieve the sleep necessary to sustain my life. Under the pressure created by the memory of my misfortunes, I doubled the usual dose and fell into a deep sleep. However, sleep did not take me away from thought and sorrow. My dreams were filled with thousands of things that instilled fear in me. Towards morning, I was shaken by a terrible nightmare. I felt the hands of the devil on my throat, and I couldn't free myself. Moans and screams were ringing in my ears. When my father, who never took his eyes off me, noticed my restlessness, he woke me up. There were wild waves around, clouds in the sky, but the devil was nowhere to be seen. It was a kind of sense of security; a truce between the present and the inevitable, a peaceful forgetfulness granted by my disaster-filled future and inclined by the nature of the human mind.
es_translation: Since I had recovered from the fever, I had become accustomed to taking a small amount of laudanum each night, as only with the help of this drug could I obtain the rest necessary to keep myself alive. Tortured by the memory of my many misfortunes, I took a double dose and soon fell into a deep sleep. But sleep did not free me from my thoughts or my misfortune, and I dreamed of a thousand things that terrified me. Near dawn, I had a horrible nightmare: I felt the evil being squeezing my throat; I could not free myself from its claw, and wails and screams echoed in my head. My father, who was watching over my sleep, noticed my distress and, waking me, pointed out the port of Holyhead, which we were entering.

en: The conclusion of this speech convinced my father that my ideas were deranged, and he instantly changed the subject of our conversation and endeavoured to alter the course of my thoughts. He wished as much as possible to obliterate the memory of the scenes that had taken place in Ireland and never alluded to them or suffered me to speak of my misfortunes.
vi: Đoạn kết của bài ca này khiến cha tôi càng tin chắc đầu óc tôi không tỉnh táo, và ông lập tức thay đổi đề tài chuyện trò, cố gắng đưa tôi chuyển dòng suy nghĩ. Ông hết lòng mong xóa sạch khỏi ký ức tôi những cảnh tượng xảy ra ở Ireland, và không bao giờ còn nói bóng gió đến chúng, cũng không bao giờ bắt tôi nhắc lại những bất hạnh của mình.
tr: Konuşmamın sonu babamı sapkın fikirlere kapıldığıma tamamen ikna etti ve hemen başka konuya geçiş yaparak düşüncelerimin akışını değiştirmeye çalıştı. İrlanda’da yaşananların anılarını olabildiğince unutturabilmek niyetindeydi, bu nedenle onları hatırlatacak ya da talihsizliklerimden söz etmemi gerektirecek durumlardan kaçınıyordu.
es: Mis últimas palabras convencieron a mi padre de que tenía las ideas trastornadas, y al instante cambió el tema de nuestra conversación, intentando desviar así mis pensamientos. Deseaba borrar de mi memoria las escenas que habían tenido lugar en Irlanda, y ni aludía a ellas ni me permitía hablar de mis desgracias.
vi_translation: The ending of this song made my father even more convinced that my mind was not clear, and he immediately changed the subject of the conversation, trying to steer my thoughts in a different direction. He wholeheartedly wished to erase from my memory the scenes that happened in Ireland, and never again alluded to them, nor did he ever make me recount my misfortunes.
tr_translation: The end of my speech completely convinced my father that I had fallen into heretical ideas, and he immediately tried to change the subject to alter the flow of my thoughts. He intended to make me forget the memories of what happened in Ireland as much as possible, so he avoided situations that would remind me of them or require me to talk about my misfortunes.
es_translation: My last words convinced my father that my ideas were disturbed, and he instantly changed the subject of our conversation, trying to divert my thoughts. He wished to erase from my memory the scenes that had taken place in Ireland, and neither alluded to them nor allowed me to speak of my misfortunes.

en: Those were the last moments of my life during which I enjoyed the feeling of happiness. We passed rapidly along; the sun was hot, but we were sheltered from its rays by a kind of canopy while we enjoyed the beauty of the scene, sometimes on one side of the lake, where we saw Mont Salêve, the pleasant banks of Montalègre, and at a distance, surmounting all, the beautiful Mont Blanc, and the assemblage of snowy mountains that in vain endeavour to emulate her; sometimes coasting the opposite banks, we saw the mighty Jura opposing its dark side to the ambition that would quit its native country, and an almost insurmountable barrier to the invader who should wish to enslave it.
vi: Đây là những giờ phút hạnh phúc cuối cùng của đời tôi. Chúng tôi lướt khá nhanh dọc theo dòng nước; mặt trời dữ dội, nhưng chúng tôi tránh nắng dưới một tán dù, trong khi thưởng ngoạn cảnh đẹp, lúc thì ở bờ hồ bên này, nơi chúng tôi trông thấy ngọn Saleve, những đoạn bờ hồ vui mắt của Montalègre, và ở xa xa, vươn cao hơn tất cả, là đỉnh Mont Blanc tuyệt đẹp, và rặng núi phủ tuyết quần tụ chung quanh, hoài công đua tranh cùng nó; lúc thì chúng tôi sang bờ hồ bên kia chiêm ngưỡng núi Jura hùng vĩ đưa mặt tối chắn đường kẻ tham lam muốn vượt xứ sở mình, và là rào cản gần như không vượt nổi với kẻ xâm lăng muốn biến nó thành nô lệ.
tr: İşte bunlar hayatımda mutluluğun tadına varabildiğim son anlardı. Hızla ilerliyorduk. Hava sıcaktı ama biz bir gölgeliğin altında güneşten korunuyor, manzaranın keyfine varıyorduk. Kimi zaman Mont Salêve’yi görebildiğimiz gölün bir yakasını, Montalêgre’nin güzelim kıyılarını, daha da uzaklarda tüm manzaranın üstünde yükselen şahane Mont Blanc'ı ve ona boş yere gıpta eden karlı dağları izledik, kimi zaman da karşı kıyı boyunca ilerlerken, ülkesini terk etmeye niyetli ihtirasa karanlık yüzünü gösteren ya da onu esarete sürüklemeyi aklına getirenlere aşılmaz bir engel teşkil eden muhteşem Jura’ yı gördük.
es: Fueron esos los últimos momentos de mi vida durante los cuales me sentí feliz. Navegábamos deprisa; el sol calentaba con fuerza, pero nos protegía un pequeño toldo. Admiramos la belleza del paisaje, costeando las orillas del lago; un lado nos ofrecía el monte Saléve, las orillas de Montalégre, el maravilloso Mont Blanc, dominando a distancia el conjunto y las montañas coronadas de nieve, que en vano intentaba competir con él.
vi_translation: These are the last happy moments of my life. We glided quite swiftly along the water; the sun was fierce, but we avoided the heat under a canopy while enjoying the beautiful scenery, sometimes on this side of the lake, where we saw the Saleve mountain, the cheerful shores of Montalègre, and in the distance, towering above all, the magnificent Mont Blanc, and the snow-covered mountains clustered around it, vainly competing with it; sometimes we moved to the other side of the lake to admire the majestic Jura mountains, presenting their dark face as a barrier to the greedy who wish to cross into their land, and an almost insurmountable obstacle to invaders who want to enslave it.
tr_translation: These were the last moments in my life when I could taste happiness. We were moving rapidly. The weather was hot, but we were sheltered from the sun under a canopy, enjoying the scenery. Sometimes we watched one side of the lake where we could see Mont Salêve, the beautiful shores of Montalêgre, and in the distance, the magnificent Mont Blanc rising above the entire landscape with the snow-capped mountains that envied it in vain; other times, as we progressed along the opposite shore, we saw the splendid Jura, which presented an insurmountable barrier to those who intended to abandon their country or to those who thought of dragging it into captivity.
es_translation: Those were the last moments of my life during which I felt happy. We sailed quickly; the sun was intensely hot, but a small awning protected us. We admired the beauty of the landscape, coasting along the shores of the lake; on one side we had Mount Saléve, the shores of Montalégre, the marvelous Mont Blanc, dominating the scene from a distance, and the snow-capped mountains that vainly tried to compete with it.

en: It was eight o’clock when we landed; we walked for a short time on the shore, enjoying the transitory light, and then retired to the inn and contemplated the lovely scene of waters, woods, and mountains, obscured in darkness, yet still displaying their black outlines.
vi: Chúng tôi lên bờ thì đã tám giờ; đi dạo một lát bên hồ tận hưởng ánh chiều tà mờ ảo, sau đó lui về quán trọ, chiêm ngưỡng khung cảnh xinh đẹp của những hồ nước, rừng, núi non, nhòa đi trong bóng tối nhưng vẫn in đậm đường viền sẫm màu của chúng.
tr: Karaya çıktığımızda saat sekizdi. Biraz sahilde yürüyüş yaparak akşam vaktinin keyfini çıkardıktan sonra hanımıza çekilip karanlıkla birlikte belirsizleşen, ancak koyu siluetleri hâlâ görünen suları, ormanları, dağları uzun uzun seyrettik.
es: Eran las ocho cuando desembarcamos. Paseamos unos momentos por la orilla disfrutando del crepúsculo y luego nos dirigimos a la posada, desde donde contemplamos la hermosa vista del lago, bosques y montañas, que, envueltas en la oscuridad, aún mostraban sus negros perfiles.
vi_translation: When we came ashore, it was already eight o'clock; we took a stroll by the lake to enjoy the dim twilight, then returned to the inn to admire the beautiful scenery of the lakes, forests, and mountains, fading into the darkness but still outlined in their dark contours.
tr_translation: When we landed, it was eight o'clock. After enjoying an evening walk along the beach, we retreated to our inn and spent a long time watching the waters, forests, and mountains, which became indistinct with the darkness but whose dark silhouettes were still visible.
es_translation: It was eight o'clock when we disembarked. We strolled for a few moments along the shore, enjoying the twilight, and then headed to the inn, from where we contemplated the beautiful view of the lake, forests, and mountains, which, shrouded in darkness, still showed their black silhouettes.

en: Great God! Why did I not then expire! Why am I here to relate the destruction of the best hope and the purest creature on earth? She was there, lifeless and inanimate, thrown across the bed, her head hanging down and her pale and distorted features half covered by her hair. Everywhere I turn I see the same figure—her bloodless arms and relaxed form flung by the murderer on its bridal bier. Could I behold this and live? Alas! Life is obstinate and clings closest where it is most hated. For a moment only did I lose recollection; I fell senseless on the ground.
vi: Trời đất ơi! Sao lúc đó tôi không chết liền cho xong! Mà còn sống để ngồi đây kể lại với anh sự hủy diệt sinh linh trong trắng nhất, niềm hy vọng tuyệt vời nhất trên trái đất này? Nàng nằm đó, bất động, không còn sinh khí, bị vất ngang giường, đầu rũ xuống, nét mặt méo mó xanh lợt bị làn tóc che phủ một phần. Giờ đây quay đi bất cứ đâu tôi cũng nhìn thấy cảnh tượng ấy: cánh tay nàng không còn hột máu, hình dáng rũ rượi mà tên giết người đã quăng lên cỗ quan tài cô dâu. Có thể nào nhìn thấy cảnh tượng ấy mà tôi còn sống? Hỡi ôi! Cuộc đời mà cứng đầu cứng cổ, càng bấu chặt lấy ta khi ta căm ghét nó vô cùng tận! Tôi mất khả năng tri giác trong một chốc, và ngã lăn xuống đất bất tỉnh.
tr: Yüce Tanrım! Neden o anda yok olup gitmedim ki? Niye hâlâ burada durmuş, yeryüzünün en güzel, en masum insanının yok oluşunu anlatabiliyorum? Elizabeth aşağı sarkan başı, soluk benzi ve kısmen saçlarıyla örtülü şekilsiz çehresiyle cansız ve hareketsiz halde fırlatıldığı yatakta boylu boyunca uzanıyordu. Nereye dönsem aynı şeyi görüyordum; Elizabeth’in kanı çekilmiş kolları ve kendisine tabut olan düğün yatağına katili tarafından atılmış gevşek bedeni. Böyle bir şeye şahit olup da yaşamam mümkün müydü? Ne var ki hayat denen şey çok inatçı ve en çok nefret edildiği yere sıkı sıkıya tutunmaya meyilli. Bu olanlardan sonra bir an bilincimi kaybettim ve yere yığıldım.
es: ¡Dios mío!, ¿cómo no morí entonces? ¿Por qué me hallo aquí narrando la destrucción de mi mayor esperanza, y la muerte de la más pura criatura? Estaba tendida en el lecho, inánime, la cabeza ladeada, las facciones pálidas y convulsas, semiocultas por el cabello. Doquiera que vaya veo la misma imagen: los brazos exangües y el cuerpo lacio, tirado sobre el tálamo nupcial por su asesino. ¿Cómo pude ver esto y seguir viviendo? ¡Cuán tenaz es la vida, y cómo se aferra a quienes más la desprecian! En un instante perdí el conocimiento, y caí al suelo.
vi_translation: Oh my God! Why didn't I just die right then and there! But instead, I am still alive to sit here and recount to you the destruction of the purest life, the most wonderful hope on this earth? She lay there, motionless, lifeless, thrown across the bed, her head drooping, her face twisted and pale, partially covered by her hair. Now, wherever I turn, I see that scene: her arm drained of blood, her limp figure that the murderer had tossed onto the bride's coffin. How can I see that scene and still be alive? Oh! Life, stubborn and unyielding, clings to us even more tightly when we utterly despise it! I lost consciousness for a moment and collapsed to the ground, fainting.
tr_translation: My Almighty God! Why didn't I just disappear at that moment? Why am I still standing here, able to recount the demise of the most beautiful, most innocent person on earth? Elizabeth lay lifeless and motionless on the bed she was thrown onto, with her head hanging down, her pale complexion, and her shapeless face partially covered by her hair. Wherever I turned, I saw the same thing; Elizabeth's blood-drained arms and her limp body thrown by her murderer onto the wedding bed that had become her coffin. Was it possible for me to witness such a thing and still live? However, life is a very stubborn thing and tends to cling tightly to the place where it is most hated. After these events, I lost consciousness for a moment and collapsed to the ground.
es_translation: My God! How did I not die then? Why am I here narrating the destruction of my greatest hope, and the death of the purest creature? She was lying on the bed, lifeless, her head tilted, her features pale and convulsed, semi-hidden by her hair. Wherever I go, I see the same image: the bloodless arms and limp body, thrown onto the bridal bed by her murderer. How could I see this and continue living? How tenacious life is, and how it clings to those who despise it the most! In an instant, I lost consciousness and fell to the ground.

en: But why should I dwell upon the incidents that followed this last overwhelming event? Mine has been a tale of horrors; I have reached their acme, and what I must now relate can but be tedious to you. Know that, one by one, my friends were snatched away; I was left desolate. My own strength is exhausted, and I must tell, in a few words, what remains of my hideous narration.
vi: Nhưng tôi đi sâu làm gì vào những chuyện xảy ra sau sự kiện kinh hoàng cuối cùng như giọt nước làm tràn ly ấy. Câu chuyện của tôi đã toàn là kinh rợn, tôi đã nói tới đỉnh tột cùng, những gì tôi sắp kể với anh sau đây sẽ chỉ làm anh chán ngắt. Chỉ cần biết rằng, bạn bè thân thiết của tôi từng người một bị tước đi, tôi chỉ còn lại một mình tuyệt vọng. Tôi đã sức cùng lực kiệt rồi; còn vài lời nữa thôi, để tôi kể nốt cho anh nghe câu chuyện ghê tởm này.
tr: Akıllara durgunluk veren bu son olaydan sonra olanların üstünde durmanın ne anlamı var ki? Hikâyem bir korku öyküsünden farksız ve şu anda o öykünün doruğuna ulaştık. Bundan sonra anlatacaklarım canını sıkmaktan başka işe yaramayacaktır. Şu kadarını söyleyeyim, sevdiklerim bir bir elimden alındı; kendimi bilmez halde kalakaldım. Doğrusu artık gücüm de tükendi. Yine de tüyler ürperten hikâyemin gerisini birkaç kelimeyle anlatmaya çalışacağım.
es: Pero para qué narrar los acontecimientos que siguieron a esta tragedia. El horror ha llenado toda mi vida; había llegado al punto culminante del sufrimiento, y lo que resta no puede más que aburrirle. Uno a uno me fueron arrebatados aquellos a quienes amaba; y me quedé solo. No tengo ya fuerzas; y explicaré lo que queda de mi horrenda narración en pocas palabras.
vi_translation: But why should I delve deeply into the events that followed that final horrifying incident, the one that was the last straw? My story has been full of horror; I have reached the ultimate peak, and what I am about to tell you next will only bore you. Just know that my close friends were taken away from me one by one, leaving me utterly alone and desperate. I am exhausted; just a few more words, let me finish telling you this dreadful story.
tr_translation: After this mind-boggling recent event, what is the point of dwelling on what happened? My story is no different from a horror tale, and right now we have reached the climax of that tale. What I will tell from now on will serve no purpose other than to upset you. Let me just say this much, my loved ones were taken from me one by one; I was left in a state of bewilderment. Honestly, my strength is now exhausted. Still, I will try to recount the rest of my spine-chilling story in a few words.
es_translation: But why narrate the events that followed this tragedy. Horror has filled my entire life; I had reached the pinnacle of suffering, and what remains can only bore you. One by one, those I loved were taken from me; and I was left alone. I no longer have the strength; and I will explain what remains of my horrendous tale in a few words.

en: I was answered through the stillness of night by a loud and fiendish laugh. It rang on my ears long and heavily; the mountains re-echoed it, and I felt as if all hell surrounded me with mockery and laughter. Surely in that moment I should have been possessed by frenzy and have destroyed my miserable existence but that my vow was heard and that I was reserved for vengeance. The laughter died away, when a well-known and abhorred voice, apparently close to my ear, addressed me in an audible whisper, “I am satisfied, miserable wretch! You have determined to live, and I am satisfied.”
vi: Trả lời tôi qua màn đêm tĩnh lặng là một tràng cười ma quỷ. Nó vang lên trong tai tôi rất lâu và nặng nề; và núi non dội lại, khiến tôi cảm thấy như thể cả địa ngục đang vây lấy tôi mà cười cợt. Lẽ ra lúc đó tôi hẳn đã phát điên mà tự kết liễu cuộc đời khổ sở của mình, nếu không phải lời thề của tôi đã được nghe thấu, và tính mạng tôi được bảo toàn mà trả hận. Tiếng cười tắt lịm, khi một giọng nói ghê tởm quen thuộc, gần sát tai tôi, nói với tôi bằng tiếng thì thầm rành mạch: “Ta hài lòng lắm, kẻ khốn nạn kia! mi đã quyết sống, và ta hài lòng lắm!”
tr: Gecenin sessizliği içinden bana gürültülü, şeytani bir kahkaha karşılık verdi. Kahkaha tüm şiddetiyle kulaklarımda çınladı. Dağlar onunla yankılandı ve etrafımı saran cehennemin benimle alay ettiği, bana güldüğünü hissettim. Yeminim duyulmamış, intikam için hayatta bırakılmamış olsam, şüphesiz ki o anda aklımı yitirir, sefil hayatıma bir son verirdim. Kahkahanın yankısı kesilince, belli ki çok yakınımdan gelen o tanıdık ve iğrenç ses bana bir fısıltıyla seslendi. "Artık tatmin oldum, zavallı yaratık! Sen yaşamaya karar verdin ve ben tatmin oldum.
es: Desde la profunda quietud de la noche, me llegó entonces una estruendosa y diabólica carcajada. Resonó en mis oídos larga y dolorosamente; los montes me devolvieron su eco, y sentí que el infierno me rodeaba burlándose y riéndose de mí. En aquel momento, de no ser porque aquello significaba que mi juramento había sido escuchado y que me aguardaba la venganza, me hubiera dejado dominar por el frenesí y hubiera acabado con mi existencia miserable[94]. La carcajada se fue extinguiendo, y una voz, familiar y aborrecida, me susurró con claridad, cerca del oído: —¡Estoy satisfecho, miserable criatura! Has decidido vivir, y eso me satisface.
vi_translation: Answering me through the silent night was a demonic laughter. It echoed in my ears for a long and heavy time; and the mountains reverberated, making me feel as if the entire hell was surrounding me and mocking. At that moment, I would have surely gone mad and ended my miserable life, if not for my vow being heard, and my life being preserved for revenge. The laughter died away, as a familiar, disgusting voice, close to my ear, whispered clearly to me: “I am very pleased, wretched one! You have decided to live, and I am very pleased!”
tr_translation: The silence of the night was answered by a loud, demonic laugh. The laugh echoed in my ears with all its intensity. The mountains resounded with it, and I felt that the hell surrounding me was mocking me, laughing at me. If my vow had not been unheard, if I had not been left alive for revenge, I would undoubtedly have lost my mind at that moment and ended my miserable life. When the echo of the laugh ceased, that familiar and disgusting voice, clearly coming from very close to me, whispered to me. "I am satisfied now, poor creature! You decided to live, and I am satisfied."
es_translation: From the profound stillness of the night, a thunderous and diabolical laugh then reached me. It resonated in my ears long and painfully; the mountains echoed it back to me, and I felt that hell surrounded me, mocking and laughing at me. At that moment, if it weren't for the fact that it meant my oath had been heard and that revenge awaited me, I would have let frenzy take over and ended my miserable existence[94]. The laugh faded away, and a familiar and hated voice clearly whispered near my ear: —I am satisfied, miserable creature! You have decided to live, and that satisfies me.

en: It is past; I am returning to England. I have lost my hopes of utility and glory; I have lost my friend. But I will endeavour to detail these bitter circumstances to you, my dear sister; and while I am wafted towards England and towards you, I will not despond.
vi: Tất cả đã qua rồi; em đang trở về Anh. Em đã mất mọi hy vọng về sự hữu dụng của mình cũng như về vinh quang - em đã mất người bạn của em nữa. Nhưng em sẽ cố gắng kể chi tiết chị nghe những chuyện bi thảm đó, chị thân yêu ạ; và bởi đang theo dòng về nước Anh, về với chị, em sẽ không nản chí.
tr: Her şey geride kaldı, artık İngiltere'ye dönüyorum. İnsanlığa faydalı olma ve üne erişmeye dair tüm ümitlerim tükendi; dostumu kaybettim. Yine de bu acı dolu olayları olabildiğince aktarmaya çalışacağım canım kardeşim ve İngiltere'ye, sana doğru sürüklenirken moralimi bozmamaya çalışacağım.
es: Todo ha concluido; vuelvo a Inglaterra. He perdido mis esperanzas de gloria y mi ansia de servir a la humanidad; y he perdido a mi amigo. Pero trataré, querida hermana, de contarte con detalle estos tristes sucesos; no quiero navegar rumbo a Inglaterra, y hacia ti, lleno de pesadumbre.
vi_translation: Everything is over; I am returning to England. I have lost all hope of my usefulness as well as of glory - I have lost my friend too. But I will try to tell you in detail about those tragic events, my dear sister; and because I am on my way back to England, back to you, I will not be discouraged.
tr_translation: Everything is behind me now, I am returning to England. All my hopes of being useful to humanity and achieving fame have vanished; I lost my friend. Still, I will try to convey these painful events as much as I can, my dear brother, and as I drift towards England, towards you, I will try not to lose my morale.
es_translation: Everything has ended; I am returning to England. I have lost my hopes for glory and my desire to serve humanity; and I have lost my friend. But I will try, dear sister, to tell you in detail about these sad events; I do not want to sail towards England, and towards you, filled with sorrow.
